original: de la ji ltar na /🔽'o ma de gdug pa'ang yin la /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na / 'o ma de gdug pa'ang yin la /

analyzed: pe'u yang shin tu dul zhing 'tsho ba'i sa'ang ri mthon po'i steng ma yin /

analyzed: nags khrod ma yin pa na 'tsho zhing /

analyzed: 'gro ba dang sdod ba'ang bag yangs su 'gyur ba'i ba'i 'o ma ni nad rnams la phan pas bdud rtsi zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de ma yin pa ni thams cad kyang gdug pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o // de'i tshe na rgyal po @57a *//

analyzed: chen pos de skad ces smras pa thos nas sman pa legs so //

original: shin tu legs par smras so //
analyzed: shin tu legs par smras so //
translated: You have spoken very well.

analyzed: da slan chad 'o ma bzang ngan dang / rung mi rung yang shes so //

analyzed: yul mi rnams kyis de skad ces thos nas thams cad gshe ste /

original: rgyal po chen po 'di ni yi dvags kyis brlams sam /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po 'di ni yi dvags kyis brlams sam /

original: smyos sam ci nyes na /
analyzed: smyos sam ci nyes na /

original: bdag cag bslus te /
analyzed: bdag cag bslus te /

original: sman du 'o ma thong zhig ces gsung /
analyzed: sman du 'o ma thong zhig ces gsung /
translated: You say, ‘Take milk as medicine.’

original: yul mi thams cad khros bzhin du rgyal po'i spyan sngar lhags so //
analyzed: yul mi thams cad khros bzhin du rgyal po'i spyan sngar lhags so //
translated: ” All the people of the country came to the king’s presence in anger.

original: de la rgyal pos bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de la rgyal pos bka' stsal pa /
translated: The king said to them,

original: khyed nga la ma gshe zhig /
analyzed: khyed nga la ma gshe zhig /
translated: “Do not scold me.

original: sman du 'o ma btang du rung ngam /
analyzed: sman du 'o ma btang du rung ngam /
translated: Is it suitable to take milk as medicine?

original: mi rung ba ni sman pa 'di'i dpyad yin gyi /
analyzed: mi rung ba ni sman pa 'di'i dpyad yin gyi /
translated: It is the doctor’s diagnosis that it is unsuitable.

original: das ni ma nyes so //
analyzed: das ni ma nyes so //
translated: He is not at fault.”

original: de'i tshe rgyal po chen po dang / yul mi thams cad kyang shin tu dga' zhing mgu bar gyur nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyal po chen po dang / yul mi thams cad kyang shin tu dga' zhing mgu bar gyur nas /

original: sman pa de la lhag par rim gro dang bkur sti bskyed de /
analyzed: sman pa de la lhag par rim gro dang bkur sti bskyed de /
translated: They greatly honored and respected the doctor.

original: nad pa thams cad la sman 'o ma btang bas nad kyang byang bar gyur to //
analyzed: nad pa thams cad la sman 'o ma btang bas nad kyang byang bar gyur to //
translated: All the sick people drank the milk medicine and their illnesses were cured.

original: dge slong khyed kyang de lta bu'i tshul du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /
analyzed: dge slong khyed kyang de lta bu'i tshul du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /
translated: Monks, you should understand that the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One,

original: mkhyen pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
analyzed: mkhyen pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
translated: the one with knowledge and conduct,

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /

original: 'jig rten rig pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten rig pa /
translated: the knower of the world,

original: bla na med pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa /
translated: the unsurpassed one,

original: skyes bu 'dul zhing kha lo sgyur ba /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul zhing kha lo sgyur ba /
translated: the trainer of those who can be trained,

original: lha dang mi @57b rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la de ltar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lha dang mi @57b rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la de ltar rig par bya ste /
translated: the teacher of gods and humans, the Buddha, the Blessed One, is like that.

original: sman pa chen po lta bur 'jig rten du gshegs nas /
analyzed: sman pa chen po lta bur 'jig rten du gshegs nas /
translated: Having come into the world like a great doctor,

original: mu stegs can ngan par lta ba'i sman pa thams cad btul nas rgyal po thams cad la nga ni sman pa'o zhes brjod de /
analyzed: mu stegs can ngan par lta ba'i sman pa thams cad btul nas rgyal po thams cad la nga ni sman pa'o zhes brjod de /
translated: He subdued all the non-Buddhist physicians with their evil views, and announced to all the kings, “I am the physician.”

original: mu stegs can dag gdul ba'i phyir 'di skad du bdag med do //
analyzed: mu stegs can dag gdul ba'i phyir 'di skad du bdag med do //
translated: In order to subdue the non-Buddhists, he said, “There is no self.

original: gang zag med /
analyzed: gang zag med /
translated: There is no person.

original: sems can med /
analyzed: sems can med /
translated: There are no sentient beings.

original: 'tsho ba med /
analyzed: 'tsho ba med /
translated: There is no life.

original: shes can med /
analyzed: shes can med /
translated: There is no knower.

original: shed bdag med /
analyzed: shed bdag med /
translated: There is no soul.

original: shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / bya ba dang / byed pa po med do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / bya ba dang / byed pa po med do zhes gsungs so //
translated: There is no cognition, no seeing, no action, and no agent.”

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Bhikṣus,

original: mu stegs can gyis bdag ces brjod pa ni srin bu'i rjes las yi ger gyur pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyis bdag ces brjod pa ni srin bu'i rjes las yi ger gyur pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: the non-Buddhists’ use of the word “self” is like the letters that are made from the tracks of insects.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pas ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la bdag med do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pas ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la bdag med do zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata said, “In the Buddha’s teachings there is no self.”

original: de ni sems can gdul pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni sems can gdul pa'i phyir /

original: dus mkhyen pa'i phyir de ltar bdag med ces gsungs pa'ang rgyu yod /
analyzed: dus mkhyen pa'i phyir de ltar bdag med ces gsungs pa'ang rgyu yod /
translated: Because he knows the time, he said, “There is no self,” and there is a reason for that.

original: rkyen yod pas na /
analyzed: rkyen yod pas na /
translated: Because there are causes and conditions,

original: bdag yod ces gsungs pa ni ji ltar sman pa mkhas pas 'o ma la sman du rung ba dang mi rung ba shes pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: bdag yod ces gsungs pa ni ji ltar sman pa mkhas pas 'o ma la sman du rung ba dang mi rung ba shes pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: The statement “the self exists” is like the case of a skilled physician who knows whether milk is suitable as medicine or not.

original: byis pa ma rabs kyis bdag tu 'dzin pa lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byis pa ma rabs kyis bdag tu 'dzin pa lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not like the self-grasping of foolish, ordinary beings.

original: byis pa ma rabs kyis bdag tu 'dzin pa ni mthe bo tsam zhe'am /🔽yungs kar tsam zhe'am /
analyzed: byis pa ma rabs kyis bdag tu 'dzin pa ni mthe bo tsam zhe'am / yungs kar tsam zhe'am /
translated: The self-grasping of foolish, ordinary beings is the size of a thumb,🔽the size of a mustard seed,

original: rdul phra mo tsam du 'dzin to //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa bdag ces brjod pa ni de lta bu ma yin pas chos thams cad la bdag med do zhes gsungs kyang yang dag par na bdag med pa @58a *//
analyzed: rdul phra mo tsam du 'dzin to // de bzhin gshegs pa bdag ces brjod pa ni de lta bu ma yin pas chos thams cad la bdag med do zhes gsungs kyang yang dag par na bdag med pa @58a *//
translated: or the size of an atom.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: The Tathāgata’s statement “the self” is not like that. Therefore, although he says “all phenomena are selfless,” in reality they are not selfless.

original: bdag ces bya ba ni chos gang bden pa /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba ni chos gang bden pa /
translated: What is called the “self” is a phenomenon that is true,

original: yang dag pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa /
translated: real,

original: rtag pa gnas pa /
analyzed: rtag pa gnas pa /
translated: permanent, stable,

original: bdag por gyur pa /
analyzed: bdag por gyur pa /
translated: a master,

original: mi 'gyur mi 'pho ba de ni bdag ces bya ste /
analyzed: mi 'gyur mi 'pho ba de ni bdag ces bya ste /
translated: and unchanging and unmoving.

original: ji ltar sman pa chen po de sman 'o ma la mkhas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sman pa chen po de sman 'o ma la mkhas pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the case of that great physician who is skilled in the use of milk as medicine.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is also like that.

original: so so'i skye bo'i phyir chos thams cad la yang dag par bdag yod do zhes gsungs kyi /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i phyir chos thams cad la yang dag par bdag yod do zhes gsungs kyi /
translated: For the sake of ordinary people, it is said that all phenomena truly have a self.

original: khyed la sogs pas 'khor rnam bzhi'ang de lta bu'i tshul du chos thams cad la nan tan gyis shig //
analyzed: khyed la sogs pas 'khor rnam bzhi'ang de lta bu'i tshul du chos thams cad la nan tan gyis shig //
translated: You and the rest of the fourfold assembly should also diligently apply yourselves to all phenomena in this way.

original: 'phags pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo /
analyzed: 'phags pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo /
translated: Noble Great Parinirvāṇa Sūtra

original: bam po bzhi pa /
analyzed: bam po bzhi pa /
translated: Scroll Four

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan yang dge slong rnams la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan yang dge slong rnams la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One further said to the monks:

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Monks,

original: khyed 'dul pa la ji tsam the tshom du gyur pa de dag ji dga' bar dris shig dang / ngas bstan cing bshad de khyed kyis sems rangs par bya'o //
analyzed: khyed 'dul pa la ji tsam the tshom du gyur pa de dag ji dga' bar dris shig dang / ngas bstan cing bshad de khyed kyis sems rangs par bya'o //
translated: whatever doubts you have about the Vinaya, ask as you wish, and I will teach and explain so that your minds will be satisfied.

original: ngas ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid du mngon par rtogs te /
analyzed: ngas ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid du mngon par rtogs te /
translated: I have realized that all phenomena are empty by nature.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Monks,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du rtogs par zad do snyam du mi bsam mo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ni chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du rtogs par zad do snyam du mi bsam mo //
translated: do not think that the Tathāgata has realized that all phenomena are empty by nature.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

original: 'dul ba la ji tsam du the tshom du gyur pa de dag da zhu ba'i dus la bab bo //
analyzed: 'dul ba la ji tsam du the tshom du gyur pa de dag da zhu ba'i dus la bab bo //
translated: if you have any doubts or uncertainties, now is the time to ask your questions.

original: de nas dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: ” The monks then said to the Blessed One,

original: @58b bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: @58b bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽we are not wise enough to ask questions of the Thus-Gone One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Buddha.

original: bdag cag ni shes rab dang mi ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la zhu zhing gsol ba'i mthu ma mchis so; ;de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: bdag cag ni shes rab dang mi ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la zhu zhing gsol ba'i mthu ma mchis so; ;de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul bsam gyis mi khyab pas ting nge 'dzin yang bsam gyis mi khyab la /🔽ston pas bstan pa'ang bsam gyis mi khyab pas bdag cag ni shes rab zhan te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul bsam gyis mi khyab pas ting nge 'dzin yang bsam gyis mi khyab la / ston pas bstan pa'ang bsam gyis mi khyab pas bdag cag ni shes rab zhan te /
translated: The Thus-Gone One’s sphere of experience is inconceivable, and so his absorption is inconceivable.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la zhu zhing gsol ba'i mthu ma mchis so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la zhu zhing gsol ba'i mthu ma mchis so //
translated: The Teacher’s teachings are inconceivable, and so we are not wise enough to ask questions of the Thus-Gone One.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: dper bgyi na /🔽rgan po la brgya nyi shu lon pa /
analyzed: dper bgyi na / rgan po la brgya nyi shu lon pa /
translated: for example,

original: rgas 'khogs pa /
analyzed: rgas 'khogs pa /
translated: an old man of a hundred and twenty years,🔽who is decrepit,

original: rtag tu na bas rtsol ba'i mthu ma mchis pa /
analyzed: rtag tu na bas rtsol ba'i mthu ma mchis pa /
translated: He was always sick and had no strength to work.

original: nyam chung ba /
analyzed: nyam chung ba /
translated: He was weak

original: tshe'i dbang du ma gyur pa gcig la /
analyzed: tshe'i dbang du ma gyur pa gcig la /
translated: and had no control over his life.

original: mi phyug po don gnyer ba'i phyir yul gzhan du mchi ba zhig gser srang brgya stong du ma rgan po la gtams nas /
analyzed: mi phyug po don gnyer ba'i phyir yul gzhan du mchi ba zhig gser srang brgya stong du ma rgan po la gtams nas /
translated: A rich man, in order to pursue his goals, was going to another country. He entrusted many hundreds of thousands of gold coins to the old man,

original: 'di skad du bdag gi nor bu rin po che 'di khyod la gtams kyi /🔽lo bcu 'am /
analyzed: 'di skad du bdag gi nor bu rin po che 'di khyod la gtams kyi / lo bcu 'am /
translated: saying, “I entrust this precious jewel to you.🔽After ten years,

original: gal te lo nyi shu na phyir 'khor gyi /
analyzed: gal te lo nyi shu na phyir 'khor gyi /
translated: or after twenty years, when I return,

original: slar byin cig ces smras so //
analyzed: slar byin cig ces smras so //
translated: give it back to me.”

original: rgan po des rin po che de blangs nas ring po ma lon par nad kyis shi ste /
analyzed: rgan po des rin po che de blangs nas ring po ma lon par nad kyis shi ste /
translated: The old man took the jewel, but before long he died of illness.

analyzed: rabs kyang chad pas rin po che des ci gtams pa rnams kyang thams cad 'khyams par gyur to //
translated: Since his family line was cut off, all those to whom he had entrusted the jewel were scattered.

analyzed: nor bdag phyir log nas slar blangs pa'i gnas ma mchis par gyur to // de ltar glen pa de gtams pa'i rigs sam /
translated: The owner of the jewel returned, but there was no place to get it back.

original: mi rigs pa'i gnas mi 'tshal bas @59a *//
analyzed: mi rigs pa'i gnas mi 'tshal bas @59a *//
translated: In that way, the fool did not know whether it was right or wrong to entrust it.

original: yul gzhan nas slar 'khor yang rin po che kun 'khyams te slar blang ba'i gnas ma mchis so //
analyzed: yul gzhan nas slar 'khor yang rin po che kun 'khyams te slar blang ba'i gnas ma mchis so //
translated: Even if they return from other lands, they will have lost all the jewels and will have no place to retrieve them.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: bdag cag nyan thos rnams kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: bdag cag nyan thos rnams kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: we śrāvakas are also like this.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dang yang nan tan du 'dul ba bsan pa ni thos nas gzungs su 'dzin cing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas yang dang yang nan tan du 'dul ba bsan pa ni thos nas gzungs su 'dzin cing /
translated: Although the Tathāgata has repeatedly emphasized the training, we have heard it and retained it in memory,

original: chos yun du gnas par bgyid mi nus pa ni /
analyzed: chos yun du gnas par bgyid mi nus pa ni /
translated: but we are unable to make the Dharma last.

original: ji ltar rgan po des pha rol pos gtams pa blangs pa dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar rgan po des pha rol pos gtams pa blangs pa dang mtshungs te /
translated: It is like that old man who received what others entrusted to him.

original: bdag cag la shes rab ma mchis pas 'dul ba rnams la gang zhu zhing 'dri ba'i cha'ang ma mchis so //
analyzed: bdag cag la shes rab ma mchis pas 'dul ba rnams la gang zhu zhing 'dri ba'i cha'ang ma mchis so //
translated: We have no wisdom, so we have no part in asking questions about the training.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said to the bhikṣus,

original: khyed deng nga la zhus na sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i don du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: khyed deng nga la zhus na sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i don du 'gyur gyi /
translated: “If you ask me now, it will be for the benefit and happiness of all beings.

original: de bas na khyed ci dang ci 'dod pa dris shig /
analyzed: de bas na khyed ci dang ci 'dod pa dris shig /
translated: Therefore, ask whatever you wish.”

original: de nas dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bhikṣus said to the Bhagavān,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: dper na / skyes bu tshad la bab pa /
analyzed: dper na / skyes bu tshad la bab pa /
translated: it is like a man who is of average height,

original: lo nyi shu rtsa lnga lon pa /
analyzed: lo nyi shu rtsa lnga lon pa /
translated: twenty-five years old,

original: shin tu lang tsho ba; byad gzugs dang ldan pa /
analyzed: shin tu lang tsho ba; byad gzugs dang ldan pa /
translated: in the prime of life, handsome,

original: nor rin po che gser dang / dngul dang / bee d'urya rab tu mang ba /
analyzed: nor rin po che gser dang / dngul dang / bee d'urya rab tu mang ba /
translated: with much wealth of precious jewels, gold, silver, and beryl,

original: pha dang / ma dang / chung ma dang / bu dang / 'khor du bcas pa zhig la /
analyzed: pha dang / ma dang / chung ma dang / bu dang / 'khor du bcas pa zhig la /
translated: who has a father, mother, wife, children, and attendants.

original: gal te mi zhig gis nor rin po che dag gtams te /
analyzed: gal te mi zhig gis nor rin po che dag gtams te /
translated: If someone were to entrust him with precious jewels,

original: de la 'di skad du bdag ni don gnyer zhing yul gzhan du mchi'i /
analyzed: de la 'di skad du bdag ni don gnyer zhing yul gzhan du mchi'i /
translated: saying, ‘I am going to another country on business.

original: nor rin po che 'di dag khyod la gtams kyi /
analyzed: nor rin po che 'di dag khyod la gtams kyi /

original: shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar du mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes smras te /🔽de ni yang dag par rnam par grol ba'am /
analyzed: shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar du mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes smras te / de ni yang dag par rnam par grol ba'am /
translated: and up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception is nirvana.🔽But they do not attain complete liberation

original: mya ngan las 'da' pa mi thob pa ni /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' pa mi thob pa ni /
translated: or nirvana.

original: ji ltar rkun po de dag mar gyi snying po mi thob pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rkun po de dag mar gyi snying po mi thob pa bzhin no //
translated: Just like those thieves who did not get any butter.

original: skye bo ma rabs dag tshangs par spyod pa cung zad tsam dang / pha ma la @70b sri zhu byas pa tsam gyi rgyu dang rkyen gyis mtho ris kyi lhar skye ste /
analyzed: skye bo ma rabs dag tshangs par spyod pa cung zad tsam dang / pha ma la @70b sri zhu byas pa tsam gyi rgyu dang rkyen gyis mtho ris kyi lhar skye ste /
translated: “Ordinary people are reborn as gods in the heavens because of the causes and conditions of a little pure conduct and a little respect for their parents.

original: bde ba'i longs spyod cung zad myong ba ni /
analyzed: bde ba'i longs spyod cung zad myong ba ni /
translated: They experience a little happiness and pleasure.

original: ji ltar rkun po de dag 'o ma la chus bsnan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rkun po de dag 'o ma la chus bsnan pa bzhin no //
translated: Just like those thieves who added water to the milk.

original: skye bo ma rabs dag ni tshangs par spyod pa cung zad tsam dang / pha ma la sri zhu byas pa tsam gyi rgyus mtho ris kyi lhar skyes par mi shes so //
analyzed: skye bo ma rabs dag ni tshangs par spyod pa cung zad tsam dang / pha ma la sri zhu byas pa tsam gyi rgyus mtho ris kyi lhar skyes par mi shes so //
translated: Ordinary people do not know that they are reborn as gods in the heavens because of the causes and conditions of a little pure conduct and a little respect for their parents.

original: gzhan yang tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro bar mi shes so //
analyzed: gzhan yang tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro bar mi shes so //
translated: Moreover, they do not know about moral precepts, meditative concentration, wisdom, or taking refuge in the Three Treasures.

original: de ltar mi shes pas rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa smra mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar mi shes pas rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa smra mod kyi /
translated: Because they do not know these things, they claim that there is permanence, happiness, self, and purity.

original: de'ang mi shes so //
analyzed: de'ang mi shes so //
translated: But they do not know these things.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du gshegs nas rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa bstan cing bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du gshegs nas rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa bstan cing bshad do //
translated: Therefore, when the Tathāgata appears in the world, he teaches and explains permanence, happiness, self, and purity.

original: ji ltar 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po 'jig rten du byung na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po 'jig rten du byung na /
translated: When a universal monarch appears in the world,

original: de'i bsod nams kyi shugs kyis rkun po ma rungs pa dag so sor 'byer zhing 'bros so //
analyzed: de'i bsod nams kyi shugs kyis rkun po ma rungs pa dag so sor 'byer zhing 'bros so //
translated: by the power of his merit, evil thieves scatter and flee.

original: ba rnams ma shi bas 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal pos rdzi'u thabs dang ldan pa la gtad de /
analyzed: ba rnams ma shi bas 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal pos rdzi'u thabs dang ldan pa la gtad de /
translated: The cows do not die, and the universal monarch entrusts them to a skilled cowherd.

original: rdzi'u thabs dang ldan pas mar gyi snying po'ang yod par gyur to //
analyzed: rdzi'u thabs dang ldan pas mar gyi snying po'ang yod par gyur to //
translated: The skilled cowherd obtains the essence of the milk.

original: mar gyi snying po yod pas sems can thams cad kyang nad kyi sdug bsngal dang bral lo //
analyzed: mar gyi snying po yod pas sems can thams cad kyang nad kyi sdug bsngal dang bral lo //
translated: Because of the essence of butter, all sentient beings are free from the suffering of illness.

original: chos kyi 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po 'jig rten du gshegs nas skye bo ma rabs dag tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab ston mi nus te /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po 'jig rten du gshegs nas skye bo ma rabs dag tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab ston mi nus te /
translated: When the Dharma-turning king appears in the world, the vulgar cannot teach morality, concentration, and wisdom.

original: so sor 'byer zhing 'bros so //
analyzed: so sor 'byer zhing 'bros so //
translated: They disperse and flee.

original: @71a *// de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten gyis chos dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos sems can gyi don du byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bstan cing bshad nas /
analyzed: @71a *// de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten gyis chos dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos sems can gyi don du byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bstan cing bshad nas /
translated: At that time, the Bhagavān taught and explained to the bodhisattvas the worldly and transcendent dharmas for the sake of sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang mar gyi snying po lta bu thob par gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang mar gyi snying po lta bu thob par gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattvas also attained the essence of butter.

original: gzhan yang sems can mtha' yas dpag tu med pa dag bla na med pa'i chos bdud rtsi lta bu thob par bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can mtha' yas dpag tu med pa dag bla na med pa'i chos bdud rtsi lta bu thob par bya ba ni /
translated: Moreover, for the sake of countless, limitless sentient beings, they attained the unsurpassed nectar-like Dharma.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: The permanence, bliss, self, and purity of the Tathāgata’s dharmas.

original: don de lta bas na /
analyzed: don de lta bas na /
translated: Because of this meaning,

original: rigs kyi bu; de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa dang mi 'gyur ba'i chos can yin te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu; de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa dang mi 'gyur ba'i chos can yin te /
translated: “Son of good family, the Tathāgata is one whose nature is permanent and unchanging.

original: 'jig rten pa skye bo ma rabs dag gis tshangs pa'i lha la sogs pa la rtag pa'i chos can yin no zhes smra ba dang mi 'dra ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa skye bo ma rabs dag gis tshangs pa'i lha la sogs pa la rtag pa'i chos can yin no zhes smra ba dang mi 'dra ste /
translated: Unlike the worldly ignorant who say that Brahmā and other gods are ones whose nature is permanent,

original: rtag pa'i chos su grags pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rtag pa'i chos su grags pa 'di ni /
translated: this fame of a permanent nature

original: mdor na de bzhin gshegs pa la bya'i /
analyzed: mdor na de bzhin gshegs pa la bya'i /
translated: is, in brief, to be applied to the Tathāgata.

original: chos gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not to be applied to other dharmas.

original: 'od srung / de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i skur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srung / de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i skur rig par bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, it should be known in this way: the body of the Tathāgata.

original: 'od srung / gang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo dag ni rtag tu rtse gcig pa'i sems kyis sangs rgyas rtag pa dang gnas pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di gnyis la nan tan bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srung / gang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo dag ni rtag tu rtse gcig pa'i sems kyis sangs rgyas rtag pa dang gnas pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di gnyis la nan tan bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, any son or daughter of good family should always, with a one-pointed mind, practice diligently these two phrases: ‘The Buddha is permanent’ and ‘The Buddha abides.’

original: 'od srung / gang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo dag ni tshig 'di gnyis la nan tan byed na /
analyzed: 'od srung / gang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo dag ni tshig 'di gnyis la nan tan byed na /
translated: Kāśyapa, if sons or daughters of good family are diligent in these two phrases,

original: gang zag de ni nga'i rjes su spyod cing ngas phyin pa'i gnas @71b su phyin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag de ni nga'i rjes su spyod cing ngas phyin pa'i gnas @71b su phyin par rig par bya'o //
translated: then know that those individuals are my followers, and that they have gone to the place where I have gone.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of a good family,

original: gang gis tshig 'di gnyis la nan tan byed pa de mtshan ma spangs na de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar dgongs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis tshig 'di gnyis la nan tan byed pa de mtshan ma spangs na de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar dgongs par rig par bya'o //
translated: if someone is diligent in these two phrases and abandons signs, know that the Tathāgata has passed into nirvāṇa.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of a good family,

original: mya ngan las 'da' ba'i don ni sangs rgyas kyi chos nyid do //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba'i don ni sangs rgyas kyi chos nyid do //
translated: the meaning of nirvāṇa is the intrinsic nature of the buddhas.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Kāśyapa said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: chos nyid ces bgyi ba'i don ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: chos nyid ces bgyi ba'i don ji lta bu lags /
translated: what is the meaning of ‘intrinsic nature’?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bdag ni chos nyid kyi don ji lta bu lags pa mi 'tshal na /
analyzed: bdag ni chos nyid kyi don ji lta bu lags pa mi 'tshal na /
translated: since I do not understand the meaning of ‘intrinsic nature,’

original: de bzhin gshegs pas thugs brtse ba'i slad du rgyas par bstan du gsol /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas thugs brtse ba'i slad du rgyas par bstan du gsol /
translated: The Tathāgata, out of compassion, should explain this in detail.”

original: chos nyid ces bgyi ba ni lus dang rnam par bral /
analyzed: chos nyid ces bgyi ba ni lus dang rnam par bral /
translated: “Dharmatā is free from the body.

original: lus dang bral ba ni ci'ang ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: lus dang bral ba ni ci'ang ma mchis pa ste /
translated: That which is free from the body does not exist at all.

original: ci'ang ma mchis na lus zhes bgyi ba'ang ji ltar rnam par gzhag /
analyzed: ci'ang ma mchis na lus zhes bgyi ba'ang ji ltar rnam par gzhag /
translated: If it does not exist at all, how can the body be established?

original: lus rnam par bzhag tu mchis na ni lus la chos nyid kyang ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus rnam par bzhag tu mchis na ni lus la chos nyid kyang ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the body is established, then the body would not have dharmatā.

original: lus la chos nyid kyang ma mchis par gyur na ji lta bur rnam par gzhag /
analyzed: lus la chos nyid kyang ma mchis par gyur na ji lta bur rnam par gzhag /
translated: If the body does not have dharmatā, how can it be established?

original: bdag gis don de dag ji ltar rig par bgyi zhes gsol nas /
analyzed: bdag gis don de dag ji ltar rig par bgyi zhes gsol nas /
translated: How can I understand these meanings?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Bhagavān said to the bodhisattva Mahākāśyapa,

original: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis 'di ltar chos nyid dgag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis 'di ltar chos nyid dgag par mi bya'o //
translated: “Son of noble family, you should not negate dharmatā in this way.

original: chos nyid ces bya ba la ni 'gog pa med do //
analyzed: chos nyid ces bya ba la ni 'gog pa med do //
translated: In dharmatā there is no negation.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: dper na / 'du shes med pa'i lha dag gzugs kyi phung po dang ldan mod kyi /🔽gzugs kyi @72a *//
analyzed: dper na / 'du shes med pa'i lha dag gzugs kyi phung po dang ldan mod kyi / gzugs kyi @72a *//
translated: For example, the gods in the realm of non-perception possess the aggregate of form.

original: 'du shes med pas lha de la ni ji ltar gnas /
analyzed: 'du shes med pas lha de la ni ji ltar gnas /
translated: But since they have no perception of form, how can they abide in that realm?

original: bde ba la ji ltar longs spyod /
analyzed: bde ba la ji ltar longs spyod /
translated: How can they enjoy happiness?

original: ji ltar 'du shes la spyod /
analyzed: ji ltar 'du shes la spyod /
translated: How can they experience perception?

original: ji ltar thos shing mthong zhes 'dri ba'i mi rigs so //
analyzed: ji ltar thos shing mthong zhes 'dri ba'i mi rigs so //
translated: How can they hear and see?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis shes pa ma yin no //
translated: The domain of the Tathāgata is not known by the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la ni 'gog pa'i chos so zhes smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la ni 'gog pa'i chos so zhes smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: You should not say that the Tathāgata’s body is a dharmic cessation.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: 'gog pa'i chos ni sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul yin gyi /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i chos ni sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul yin gyi /
translated: The dharmic cessation is the domain of the Buddha,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis shes pa ma yin no //
translated: not something known by the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: khyod kyis ni /
analyzed: khyod kyis ni /
translated: You should not ask,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang du gnas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang du gnas /
translated: “Where does the Tathāgata abide?

original: gang du spyod /
analyzed: gang du spyod /
translated: Where does he practice?

original: gang du gzigs /
analyzed: gang du gzigs /
translated: Where does he look?”

original: ci la longs spyod pa rtog cing dpag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ci la longs spyod pa rtog cing dpag par mi bya'o //
translated: Do not speculate or imagine what is being enjoyed.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: don de dag ni khyod la sogs pas shes shing rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don de dag ni khyod la sogs pas shes shing rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: These meanings are not known or understood by you and others.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku dang / rnam pa sna tshogs kyi thabs ni bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku dang / rnam pa sna tshogs kyi thabs ni bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: The Dharma body of the Buddha and the inconceivable means of various aspects are not known by śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: gzhan yang sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la rtag tu dran zhing nan tan bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la rtag tu dran zhing nan tan bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should always be mindful of the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha and practice them.

original: chos rnam pa gsum po 'di ni tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: chos rnam pa gsum po 'di ni tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: These three dharmas have the characteristic of non-differentiation,

original: mi rtag pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: mi rtag pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: the characteristic of non-impermanence,

original: mi 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mi 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: and the characteristic of non-transference.

original: gang zhig chos rnam pa gsum po 'di la tha dad par 'du shes na skye bo de ni skyabs su 'gro ba gsum la mi gnas pa /
analyzed: gang zhig chos rnam pa gsum po 'di la tha dad par 'du shes na skye bo de ni skyabs su 'gro ba gsum la mi gnas pa /
translated: If one perceives these three dharmas as having differentiation, that person does not abide in the three refuges,

original: tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and is called 'one who does not possess morality'.

original: nyan thos @72b dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyang thob par mi nus so //
analyzed: nyan thos @72b dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyang thob par mi nus so //
translated: They are not even able to attain the enlightenment of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: gang gis bsam gyis mi khyab pa de la rtag pa'i 'du shes kyis nan tan byed na de ni skyabs su 'gro ba'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: gang gis bsam gyis mi khyab pa de la rtag pa'i 'du shes kyis nan tan byed na de ni skyabs su 'gro ba'i gnas yin no //
translated: If one were to take refuge in the inconceivable, and were to take refuge in the notion of permanence, that would be a place of refuge.

original: rigs kyi bu; dper na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu; dper na /
translated: Son of good family, it is like this:

original: shing yod pa'i rkyen gyis grib ma yod do //
analyzed: shing yod pa'i rkyen gyis grib ma yod do //
translated: because there is a tree, there is shade.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is like this:

original: rtag pa'i chos yod pas skyabs su 'gro ba'i gnas yod kyi /
analyzed: rtag pa'i chos yod pas skyabs su 'gro ba'i gnas yod kyi /
translated: because there is a permanent Dharma, there is a place of refuge.

original: mi rtag pa ni ma yin no; ;gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa la mi rtag pa'o zhes smra na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni ma yin no; ;gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa la mi rtag pa'o zhes smra na /
translated: If one were to say that the Tathāgata is impermanent,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang lha dang 'jig rten du bcas pa'i skyabs su 'gro ba'i gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang lha dang 'jig rten du bcas pa'i skyabs su 'gro ba'i gnas ma yin no //
translated: then the Tathāgata would not be a place of refuge for the world and its gods.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Kāśyapa said to the Buddha:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “World-Honored One,

original: dper na / nam rmus na skyes shing mchis kyang grib ma ni ma mchis so //
analyzed: dper na / nam rmus na skyes shing mchis kyang grib ma ni ma mchis so //
translated: it is like this: when the sun rises, even though it is present, there is no shade.

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Buddha said:

original: 'od srung / shing yod la grib ma med ces mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srung / shing yod la grib ma med ces mi bya'o //
translated: “Kāśyapa, one cannot say that where there is a tree there is no shade.

original: de ni sha'i mig gis mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sha'i mig gis mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the eye of flesh cannot see it.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is also like this.

original: rang bzhin nyid kyis rtag tu gnas la mi 'gyur mi 'pho mod kyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyis rtag tu gnas la mi 'gyur mi 'pho mod kyi /
translated: He always abides by his very nature, and does not change or transform.

original: shes rab kyi mig med pas ni mthong bar mi nus te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi mig med pas ni mthong bar mi nus te /
translated: But because of the absence of the eye of wisdom, one is unable to see him,

original: ji ltar nam rmus pa'i tshe shing gi grib ma mi mthong ba bzhin no //

analyzed: sems can med pa ma yin /

original: dge sbyong ma yin /
analyzed: dge sbyong ma yin /

original: bram ze ma yin /
analyzed: bram ze ma yin /

original: seng+ge lta bu; seng+ge chen po /🔽sku ma yin /
analyzed: seng+ge lta bu; seng+ge chen po / sku ma yin /

original: sku ma yin pa'ang ma yin pa /
analyzed: sku ma yin pa'ang ma yin pa /

original: brjod du med pa /
analyzed: brjod du med pa /

analyzed: chos gcig tsam gyi mtshan nyid dang yang bral ba /

analyzed: @75b mya ngan las 'da' ba na mya ngan las mi 'da' ba ste /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku ni de lta bu'i yon tan tshad med pa dam pa dang ldan no //

analyzed: 'od srung / de ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyag gcig gis mkhyen gyi /

analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis shes pa ma yin no //

analyzed: 'od srung / de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni yon tan tshad med pa dang ldan te /

original: zas rnams kyis bskyed cing gso ba'i sku ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zas rnams kyis bskyed cing gso ba'i sku ni ma yin no //

original: 'od srung / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yang dag pa'i yon tan ni 'di lta bu yin na de la na ba 'am /
analyzed: 'od srung / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yang dag pa'i yon tan ni 'di lta bu yin na de la na ba 'am /

original: sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'am /

original: snying po med pa'am /
analyzed: snying po med pa'am /

analyzed: mi brtan pa rdza so ma btang ba lta bu ga la zhig yod /

analyzed: 'od srung / de bzhin gshegs pas na ba dang sdug bsngal ba bstan pa ni sems can gdul ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis 'di ltar rig par bya ste /

analyzed: deng phyin chad khyod kyis don 'di rtse gcig pa'i sems kyis yid la bya'i /

analyzed: zas rnams kyi skur ni mi bsam mo //

analyzed: gzhan la'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni chos kyi sku yin par ston cig /

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Kāśyapa said to the Bhagavān:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

analyzed: gde ltar de bzhin gshegs pa de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan na snyun pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / @76a *//

analyzed: gzhan dag la'ang de bzhin du bstan par 'tshal lo //

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku ni rdo rje lta bur mi 'jig pa lags na /

analyzed: ci'i rgyu las gyur pa ni bdag gis mi 'tshal to //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od srung la bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: 'od srung / ngas sngon chos yongs su bsrung ba'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis rdo rje'i sku dang ldan te /

analyzed: rtag tu gnas pa dang mi 'jig par gyur to //

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: dam pa'i chos srung zhing srung ba ni khrims lnga'ang mi 'dzin te /

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis 'di skad ces gsol to //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od srung la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od srung la bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: dge slong gang du gnas kyang lus kyi yo byad tsam chog par len cing /

translated: He recited and taught extensively to others the nine divisions of the sutras of the excellent Dharma: the sutra section, the songs, the prophecies, the verses, the aphorisms, the stories, the former events, the narratives, the established instructions, the marvelous events,

translated: For the sake of benefiting and bringing happiness to sentient beings,

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /

analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba'i mdo las /

analyzed: chos smra ba de gsod do //

analyzed: chos smra ba de ci ste tshe 'phos nas yang tshul khrims 'dzin cing bdag dang gzhan gyi don byed pa zhes bya ste /

analyzed: de lta bas na ngan ni rgyal po dang / blon po chen po dang / dge bsnyen rnams kyis chos smra ba dag bsrung bar gnang ngo //

analyzed: 'od srung / de ltar tshul khrims nyams shing chos srung ba ni khyim bdag mgo reg ces bya'i /

analyzed: tshul @77b khrims srung ba la ni ma yin no ////

analyzed: 'phags pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo /

analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mngon par byung ngo //

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de 'jig rten na tshad med pa'i bar du bzhugs nas sems can gyi don mdzad de /

original: gros zhes bya ba zhig la 'khor shin tu mang zhing 'khor rnams la sengge'i sgra sgrogs te /
analyzed: gros zhes bya ba zhig la 'khor shin tu mang zhing 'khor rnams la sengge'i sgra sgrogs te /
translated: There was a monk called Dhṛṭaka who had a very large following and who roared like a lion to his followers.

original: mdo sde dgu'ang rgyas par ston pa la shin tu mkhas pas /
analyzed: mdo sde dgu'ang rgyas par ston pa la shin tu mkhas pas /
translated: He was very learned in teaching extensively the nine divisions of the scriptures.

original: dge slong rnams bran pho dang / bran mo dang / ba lang dang / lug la sogs pa chos ma yin pa'i dngos po rnams gsor mi gnang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong rnams bran pho dang / bran mo dang / ba lang dang / lug la sogs pa chos ma yin pa'i dngos po rnams gsor mi gnang ngo //
translated: He decreed, “Monks are not to keep any improper things such as male and female servants, cattle, sheep, and so forth.”

original: zhes bsgo'o // de'i tshe na dge slong tshul khrims nyams pa shin tu mang bas /
analyzed: zhes bsgo'o // de'i tshe na dge slong tshul khrims nyams pa shin tu mang bas /
translated: At that time there were many monks who had broken their ethical discipline.

original: de dag gis de skad ces bsgo ba thos nas thams cad zhe sdang gi sems skyes te /
analyzed: de dag gis de skad ces bsgo ba thos nas thams cad zhe sdang gi sems skyes te /
translated: When they heard this decree, they all became angry.

original: mtshon cha thogs nas chos smra ba de la bsnyen to //
analyzed: mtshon cha thogs nas chos smra ba de la bsnyen to //
translated: They took up weapons and went to attack the Dharma preacher.

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na yul de'i rgyal po yon tan can zhes bya ba des de lta bur gyur pa thos nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na yul de'i rgyal po yon tan can zhes bya ba des de lta bur gyur pa thos nas /
translated: At that time, the king of that country, named Guṇan, heard what had happened.

original: chos bsrung ba'i phyir de ma thag tu chos smra ba ga la ba'i drung du song ste /
analyzed: chos bsrung ba'i phyir de ma thag tu chos smra ba ga la ba'i drung du song ste /
translated: In order to protect the Dharma, he immediately went to where the Dharma preacher was.

original: dge slong tshul khrims nyams pa ma rungs pa dag dang g-yul bshams te 'thabs nas /
analyzed: dge slong tshul khrims nyams pa ma rungs pa dag dang g-yul bshams te 'thabs nas /
translated: He fought a battle with the evil monks who had violated the precepts.

original: chos smra ba'i dge slong de bgegs de las thar bar byas so //
analyzed: chos smra ba'i dge slong de bgegs de las thar bar byas so //
translated: He saved the Dharma preacher from that danger.

original: de'i tshe rgyal po de'i lus la ral gri dang / mda' dang / mtshon shakti la sogs pa mtshon cha'i rmas yungs kar tsam yang gson pa med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyal po de'i lus la ral gri dang / mda' dang / mtshon shakti la sogs pa mtshon cha'i rmas yungs kar tsam yang gson pa med do //
translated: At that time, not even a mustard seed’s worth of wounds from swords, arrows, and sakti spears remained on the king’s body.

original: de'i tshe dge slong yon tan blo gros kyi rgyal po de la shin tu legs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong yon tan blo gros kyi rgyal po de la shin tu legs so //
translated: At that time, the monk Guṇamati said to the king, ‘Excellent!

original: shin tu legs so //
analyzed: shin tu legs so //
translated: Excellent!

original: rgyal po khyod ni yang dag par dam pa'i chos shin tu bsrung ba ste /
analyzed: rgyal po khyod ni yang dag par dam pa'i chos shin tu bsrung ba ste /
translated: O King, you are truly a protector of the true Dharma.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su tshad med pa'i chos kyi snod du 'gyur @78b ro zhes smras so //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su tshad med pa'i chos kyi snod du 'gyur @78b ro zhes smras so //
translated: In the future you will become an immeasurable vessel of the Dharma.’

original: rgyal po des de'i tshe na chos thos pas sems rab tu dga' bar gyur nas de ma thag tu tshe 'phos te /
analyzed: rgyal po des de'i tshe na chos thos pas sems rab tu dga' bar gyur nas de ma thag tu tshe 'phos te /
translated: At that time, the king, having heard the Dharma, was overjoyed. Immediately after, he passed away.

original: mi g-yo ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skyes nas sangs rgyas de'i nye gnas mchog tu gyur to //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skyes nas sangs rgyas de'i nye gnas mchog tu gyur to //
translated: He was born in the Buddha-land of the Tathagata Akshobhya and became the foremost disciple of that Buddha.

original: rgyal po de'i 'khor g-yul du zhugs te brgal ba dang / dga' ste rjes su yi rang ba rnam pa thams cad byang chub kyi sems las phyir mi ldog par gyur te /
analyzed: rgyal po de'i 'khor g-yul du zhugs te brgal ba dang / dga' ste rjes su yi rang ba rnam pa thams cad byang chub kyi sems las phyir mi ldog par gyur te /
translated: The king’s retinue, having entered the battle and having crossed over, rejoiced and were grateful. They all became irreversible from the thought of enlightenment.

original: tshe 'phos nas thams cad mi g-yo ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skyes so //
analyzed: tshe 'phos nas thams cad mi g-yo ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skyes so //
translated: After they died, they were all born in the Buddha-land of Akshobhya.

original: dge slong yon tan blo gros kyang phyis tshe 'phos nas /
analyzed: dge slong yon tan blo gros kyang phyis tshe 'phos nas /
translated: The bhikshu Gunashri later died

original: de bzhin du mi g-yo ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhing du skyes te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi g-yo ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhing du skyes te /
translated: and was born in the Buddha-land of Akshobhya.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de ni nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi nang na rab 'og tu gyur to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de ni nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi nang na rab 'og tu gyur to //
translated: He became the foremost of the Sangha of shravakas of that Bhagavat Buddha.

original: de bas na dam pa'i chos nub cing zad du nye ba na de ltar bsrung zhing bskyab par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dam pa'i chos nub cing zad du nye ba na de ltar bsrung zhing bskyab par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, when the true Dharma is about to disappear and come to an end, you should protect and save it in this way.

original: 'od srung / de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po de ni nga yin no //
analyzed: 'od srung / de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po de ni nga yin no //
translated: Kasyapa, at that time and in those days, that king was me.

original: chos smra ba'i dge slong de ni sangs rgyas 'od srung zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos smra ba'i dge slong de ni sangs rgyas 'od srung zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The bhikṣu who expounded the Dharma was the Buddha Kāśyapa.

original: 'od srung / dam pa'i chos bsrungs pas de lta bu la sogs pa tshad med pa'i 'bras bu'ang thob la /
analyzed: 'od srung / dam pa'i chos bsrungs pas de lta bu la sogs pa tshad med pa'i 'bras bu'ang thob la /
translated: Kāśyapa, by protecting the true Dharma, you have attained immeasurable fruits such as these.

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis 'di ltar nga ni rnam pa sna tshogs kyi mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rnam pa sna tshogs kyis yongs su brgyan pa'i chos kyi sku dang / mi shigs pa'i sku lhun gyis grub par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis 'di ltar nga ni rnam pa sna tshogs kyi mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rnam pa sna tshogs kyis yongs su brgyan pa'i chos kyi sku dang / mi shigs pa'i sku lhun gyis grub par gyur to //
translated: Because of this cause and this condition, I have now attained the Dharma body adorned with various major and minor marks, and the indestructible body spontaneously accomplished in various ways.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis 'di skad ces @79a *//
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis 'di skad ces @79a *//
translated: ” Then the bodhisattva Kāśyapa addressed the Buddha, saying:

original: gsol to // bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol to // bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rtag pa ni rdo la ri mo bris pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rtag pa ni rdo la ri mo bris pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: the Tathāgata’s eternal body is like a drawing on stone.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: ” The Bhagavān told the bodhisattva Kāśyapa:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Good son,

original: de lta bas na dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dag shin tu brtson 'grus bskyed de /
analyzed: de lta bas na dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dag shin tu brtson 'grus bskyed de /
translated: Therefore, monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen should generate great diligence

original: dam pa'i chos bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: and protect the true-dharma.

original: dam pa'i chos bsrungs pa'i 'bras bu ni rgya che ste tshad med do //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos bsrungs pa'i 'bras bu ni rgya che ste tshad med do //
translated: The fruits of protecting the true-dharma are vast and immeasurable.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family,

original: de bas na chos srung ba'i dge bsnyen dag lag na mtshon cha thogs te /
analyzed: de bas na chos srung ba'i dge bsnyen dag lag na mtshon cha thogs te /
translated: therefore, the lay followers who protect the dharma should take up arms

original: chos srung ba'i dge slong la bsrung zhing bskyab par bya'o //
analyzed: chos srung ba'i dge slong la bsrung zhing bskyab par bya'o //
translated: and protect and guard the monks who protect the dharma.

original: gang tshul khrims lnga srung ba tsam gyis theg pa chen po'i gang zag ces mi bya'i /
analyzed: gang tshul khrims lnga srung ba tsam gyis theg pa chen po'i gang zag ces mi bya'i /
translated: One is not called a person of the Great Vehicle merely by observing the five precepts.

original: tshul khrims lnga ma bsrungs kyang /
analyzed: tshul khrims lnga ma bsrungs kyang /
translated: Even if one does not observe the five precepts,

original: dam pa'i chos srung na theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos srung na theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: if one protects the true-dharma, that is called the Great Vehicle.

original: dam pa'i chos srung na lag na mtshon cha thogs te /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos srung na lag na mtshon cha thogs te /
translated: If one protects the true-dharma, one should take up arms

original: chos smra ba la bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos smra ba la bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: and protect the dharmabhāṇakas.

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'od srung gis yang 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'od srung gis yang 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Kāśyapa then said to the Bhagavān,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: dge slong gang de ltar dge bsnyen mtshon cha thogs pa dang lhan cig 'grogs brten na de la ston pa zhes bgyi'am /
analyzed: dge slong gang de ltar dge bsnyen mtshon cha thogs pa dang lhan cig 'grogs brten na de la ston pa zhes bgyi'am /
translated: If a bhikṣu associates with a laywoman who carries a weapon, is he a teacher or not?

original: ston pa zhes mi bgyi /🔽de tshul khrims bsrung ba lags sam /
analyzed: ston pa zhes mi bgyi / de tshul khrims bsrung ba lags sam /
translated: Is he a teacher or not?🔽Does he keep the precepts or not?

original: tshul khrims nyams pa lags /
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams pa lags /
translated: Does he violate the precepts or not?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis @79b 'od srung la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis @79b 'od srung la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said to Kāśyapa:

original: de dag la tshul khrims nyas pa'o snyam du ma sems shig /
analyzed: de dag la tshul khrims nyas pa'o snyam du ma sems shig /
translated: Do not think that they violate the precepts.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas rnyog pa can gyi 'jig rten na yul 'khrugs te /
analyzed: nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas rnyog pa can gyi 'jig rten na yul 'khrugs te /
translated: in the turbulent world after my parinirvāṇa, countries will be in turmoil.

original: gcig la gcig 'phrog pas mu ges nyen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig la gcig 'phrog pas mu ges nyen par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be afflicted by famine due to stealing from each other.

original: de'i tshe na mang du 'tsho bas phongs pa'i phyir rab tu byung bar rtsol te /
analyzed: de'i tshe na mang du 'tsho bas phongs pa'i phyir rab tu byung bar rtsol te /
translated: At that time, because of the difficulty of obtaining a livelihood, they will strive to go forth.

original: de dag ni mgo reg ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni mgo reg ces bya'o //
translated: They will be called “shaven-headed ones.”

original: gang zag mgo reg de dag gang dge slong tshul khrims 'dzin cing spyod lam dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gang zag mgo reg de dag gang dge slong tshul khrims 'dzin cing spyod lam dang ldan pa /
translated: Those shaven-headed individuals will say that bhikṣus who keep the precepts, have proper conduct,

original: yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa /
translated: are pure,

original: dam pa'i chos srung ba yod na skrod do //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos srung ba yod na skrod do //
translated: If there are those who protect the true Dharma, they will be expelled.

original: gsod do // gnod pa byed do //
analyzed: gsod do // gnod pa byed do //
translated: They will be killed and harmed.

original: yang bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Again, the bodhisattva Kāśyapa addressed the Buddha, saying:

original: dge slong tshul khrims srung zhing dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa dag ji ltar grong khyer dang ljongs su sems can gdul ba'i phyir rgyu zhing mchi bar bgyi /
analyzed: dge slong tshul khrims srung zhing dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa dag ji ltar grong khyer dang ljongs su sems can gdul ba'i phyir rgyu zhing mchi bar bgyi /
translated: “How should bhikṣus who guard morality and uphold the true Dharma travel through towns and villages in order to tame sentient beings?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Good son!

original: de bas na gang tshul khrims 'dzin pa dag khyim pa mtshon cha thogs pa la brten cing 'grogs shig ces ngas gnang ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gang tshul khrims 'dzin pa dag khyim pa mtshon cha thogs pa la brten cing 'grogs shig ces ngas gnang ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, I permit those who uphold morality to rely on and associate with laypeople who carry weapons.

original: gal te rgyal po'am /
analyzed: gal te rgyal po'am /
translated: If a king,

original: blon po'am / khyim bdag gam /
analyzed: blon po'am / khyim bdag gam /
translated: a minister, a householder,

original: dge bsnyen la sogs pa chos bsrung ba'i phyir mtshon cha thogs kyang de ni tshul khrims srung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dge bsnyen la sogs pa chos bsrung ba'i phyir mtshon cha thogs kyang de ni tshul khrims srung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: or an upāsaka carries weapons in order to protect the Dharma, that is called guarding morality.

original: mtshon cha thogs mod kyi /
analyzed: mtshon cha thogs mod kyi /
translated: Although they carry weapons,

original: srog mi gcod pas de na tshul khrims srung ba'i mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: srog mi gcod pas de na tshul khrims srung ba'i mchog ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the supreme observance of the precepts.

original: 'od srung gis yang gsol nga /
analyzed: 'od srung gis yang gsol nga /
translated: ” Kāśyapa then said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: @80a *// chos srung ba ni yang dag par lta ba dang ldan te /
analyzed: @80a *// chos srung ba ni yang dag par lta ba dang ldan te /
translated: those who protect the Dharma possess right view.

original: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde rgyas par ston pa ni rgyal po'i rin po che'i gdugs dang / mar snod dang / khre 'bras dang / shing tog rnam pa sna tshogs la nam du'ang dbang mi bgyid de /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i mdo sde rgyas par ston pa ni rgyal po'i rin po che'i gdugs dang / mar snod dang / khre 'bras dang / shing tog rnam pa sna tshogs la nam du'ang dbang mi bgyid de /
translated: They do not at all engage in the king’s precious parasol, oil vessel, rice, or various fruits.

original: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti tsam gyi slad du rgyal po dang / blon po dang / khyim bdag la mi rten /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti tsam gyi slad du rgyal po dang / blon po dang / khyim bdag la mi rten /
translated: They do not rely on kings, ministers, or householders for the sake of mere gain and honor.

original: yon dag la g-yo dang sgyus 'tsho ba'i sems kyang ma mchis so //
analyzed: yon dag la g-yo dang sgyus 'tsho ba'i sems kyang ma mchis so //
translated: They do not have the thought of making a living through deceit and deception.

original: spyod lam dang ldan pas tshul khrims nyams pa'i gang zag ma rungs pa dag btul kyang /
analyzed: spyod lam dang ldan pas tshul khrims nyams pa'i gang zag ma rungs pa dag btul kyang /
translated: With proper conduct, they tame the unruly individuals who violate the precepts.

original: de ni tshul khrims 'dzin cing chos srung ba'i ston pa zhes bgyi'o //
analyzed: de ni tshul khrims 'dzin cing chos srung ba'i ston pa zhes bgyi'o //
translated: They are called teachers who uphold the precepts and protect the Dharma.

original: sems can mang po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen yang dag pa yin pas rgya mtsho ltar sems rgya che zhing yangs so //
analyzed: sems can mang po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen yang dag pa yin pas rgya mtsho ltar sems rgya che zhing yangs so //
translated: He is a true spiritual friend to many sentient beings, and his mind is as vast as the ocean.

original: 'od srung / dge slong gang rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i phyir gzhan la chos ston na gang zag de'i 'khor du gtogs pa thams cad kyang rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i phyir chos ston te /
analyzed: 'od srung / dge slong gang rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i phyir gzhan la chos ston na gang zag de'i 'khor du gtogs pa thams cad kyang rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i phyir chos ston te /
translated: Kāśyapa, if a monk teaches the Dharma to others for the sake of gain and honor, then all those who belong to his assembly will also teach the Dharma for the sake of gain and honor.

original: gang zag des bdag gi dge 'dun gyi 'khor yang ma rung bar byed do //
analyzed: gang zag des bdag gi dge 'dun gyi 'khor yang ma rung bar byed do //
translated: That person will also corrupt the assembly of the saṅgha.

original: 'od srung / dge 'dun la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'od srung / dge 'dun la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, there are three types of saṅgha:

original: tshul khrims nyams pa go 'dun gyi dge 'dun dang / glen zhing gti mug pa'i dge 'dun dang / tshul khrims 'dzin cing yongs su dag pa'i dge 'dun no //
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams pa go 'dun gyi dge 'dun dang / glen zhing gti mug pa'i dge 'dun dang / tshul khrims 'dzin cing yongs su dag pa'i dge 'dun no //
translated: the saṅgha that is a gathering of the morally degenerate, the saṅgha that is a gathering of fools and ignoramuses, and the saṅgha that is a gathering of those who uphold and are pure in their moral discipline.

original: tshul khrims nyams shing go 'dun gyi dge 'dun ni 'jigs kyang sla'i /
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams shing go 'dun gyi dge 'dun ni 'jigs kyang sla'i /
translated: The saṅgha that is a gathering of the morally degenerate and the saṅgha that is a gathering of fools and ignoramuses are easy to corrupt, even if they are afraid.

original: tshul khrims 'dzin cing yongs su dag pa'i dge 'dun ni rnyed pa @80b dang bkur sti'i rkyen gyis 'jig nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'dzin cing yongs su dag pa'i dge 'dun ni rnyed pa @80b dang bkur sti'i rkyen gyis 'jig nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The saṅgha that upholds moral discipline and is completely pure cannot be destroyed by the conditions of gain and honor.

original: de la ji ltar na tshul khrims nyams shing go 'dun gyi dge 'dun zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na tshul khrims nyams shing go 'dun gyi dge 'dun zhe na /
translated: “What is a saṅgha of moral degenerates and hypocrites?

original: dge slong gang tshul khrims srung yang rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i phyir tshul khrims nyams pa la brten te lhan cig tu 'dug gam /
analyzed: dge slong gang tshul khrims srung yang rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i phyir tshul khrims nyams pa la brten te lhan cig tu 'dug gam /
translated: If a bhikṣu, though he upholds moral discipline, associates with those who have broken moral discipline for the sake of gain and honor,

original: 'gro'am / sdong dam /
analyzed: 'gro'am / sdong dam /
translated: if he sits, walks, stands, or lies down with them,

original: 'grogs sam / gcig la gcig bshes par byed cing las mthun par byed na /🔽de ni tshul khrims nyams pa zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: 'grogs sam / gcig la gcig bshes par byed cing las mthun par byed na / de ni tshul khrims nyams pa zhes kyang bya /
translated: if he associates with them, if he befriends them, and if he does the same things as they do,🔽he is called a moral degenerate.

original: go 'dun gyi dge 'dun zhes bya'o //
analyzed: go 'dun gyi dge 'dun zhes bya'o //
translated: He is also called a member of a saṅgha of hypocrites.

original: de la ji ltar na glen zhing gti mug pa'i dge 'dun zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na glen zhing gti mug pa'i dge 'dun zhe na /
translated: “What is a saṅgha of fools and ignoramuses?

original: dge slong gang bas mthar gnas shing dbang po mi rno la /
analyzed: dge slong gang bas mthar gnas shing dbang po mi rno la /
translated: If a bhikṣu lives in a remote place, his faculties are dull,

original: rtul ba glen pa /
