translated: Therefore it is called the Great Nirvana.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mngon par shes pa'i cho 'phrul tshad med par bstan pa de la ni sems can thams cad kyis dpag pa'am rig par mi nus na /🔽khyod @97b kyis de bzhin gshegs pa 'dod chags kyi phyogs la nye bas /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mngon par shes pa'i cho 'phrul tshad med par bstan pa de la ni sems can thams cad kyis dpag pa'am rig par mi nus na / khyod @97b kyis de bzhin gshegs pa 'dod chags kyi phyogs la nye bas /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva displays immeasurable miracles of superknowledge, which cannot be fathomed or known by any sentient being.🔽How could you, who are close to the side of desire,

original: sras sgra gcan 'dzin bltams par shes par ga la rung /
analyzed: sras sgra gcan 'dzin bltams par shes par ga la rung /
translated: know that the Tathāgata gave birth to his son Rāhula?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: yun ring po nas mya ngan las 'das pa chen po 'di la gnas nas mngon par shes pa'i chos 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs ston te /
analyzed: yun ring po nas mya ngan las 'das pa chen po 'di la gnas nas mngon par shes pa'i chos 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs ston te /
translated: for a long time he has abided in this great nirvāṇa and displayed various miraculous teachings of superknowledge.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na nyi zla phrag brgya dang / dzambu'i gling phrag brgya la rnam pa sna tshogs su ston pa ni /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na nyi zla phrag brgya dang / dzambu'i gling phrag brgya la rnam pa sna tshogs su ston pa ni /
translated: In the worlds of the great trichiliocosm, he displays a hundred suns and moons, a hundred Jambudvīpas, in various ways.

original: dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mdo las rgyas par bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mdo las rgyas par bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is taught in detail in the Sūtra of the Absorption of Heroic Progress.

original: ngas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams dzambu'i gling 'dir yongs su mya ngan 'da' bar bstan kyang mthar yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ngas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams dzambu'i gling 'dir yongs su mya ngan 'da' bar bstan kyang mthar yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin no //
translated: I have demonstrated the parinirvāṇa in this Jambudvīpa of the trichiliocosm, but in the end I have not entered parinirvāṇa.

original: dzambu'i gling 'dir yum gyi lhums su bltams pa bstan pa'ang /
analyzed: dzambu'i gling 'dir yum gyi lhums su bltams pa bstan pa'ang /
translated: I have demonstrated being born in the womb of my mother in this Jambudvīpa,

original: yab dang yum nga la sras su 'du shes gzhag par bya ba'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: yab dang yum nga la sras su 'du shes gzhag par bya ba'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: in order to make my father and mother think of me as their son.

original: nga'i sku ni mthar 'dod chags 'dus pa las skyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nga'i sku ni mthar 'dod chags 'dus pa las skyes pa ma yin no //
translated: But my body is not born from the union of the father and mother.

original: nga ni bskal pa yun ring po tshad med pa'i bar du 'dod pa yongs su spangs pas /
analyzed: nga ni bskal pa yun ring po tshad med pa'i bar du 'dod pa yongs su spangs pas /
translated: For an immeasurable long eon I have abandoned desire.

original: nga'i sku 'di ni chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: nga'i sku 'di ni chos kyi sku ste /
translated: This body of mine is the dharmakāya.

original: 'jig rten pa'i rjes su mngal du zhugs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rjes su mngal du zhugs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: I have demonstrated entering the womb in accordance with the world.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: dzambu'i gling 'dir lumbi'i tshal du yum lha mdzes kyi lhums nas bltams te /
analyzed: dzambu'i gling 'dir lumbi'i tshal du yum lha mdzes kyi lhums nas bltams te /
translated: I was born in the Lumbini Grove in this Jambudvīpa from the womb of my mother, Māyādevī.

original: bltams ma thag tu shar phyogs su gom pa bdun por nas /
analyzed: bltams ma thag tu shar phyogs su gom pa bdun por nas /
translated: As soon as I was born, I took seven steps to the east🔽and said:

original: 'di skad du nga ni lha dang / mi dang / @98a *//
analyzed: 'di skad du nga ni lha dang / mi dang / @98a *//
translated: He said, ‘I am the most honored among gods, humans, and asuras.

original: lha ma yin du bcas pa'i nang na mchog tu gyur /🔽phul du gyur /
analyzed: lha ma yin du bcas pa'i nang na mchog tu gyur / phul du gyur /
translated: I am the most excellent,🔽the most supreme.

original: gtso bor gyur to zhes smra ste /
analyzed: gtso bor gyur to zhes smra ste /
translated: The main one is the self.🔽

original: yab dang / yum dang / 'jig rten du bcas pa lha dang mis mthong ba thams cad dga' nas ngo mtshar rmad kyi sems skyes so //
analyzed: yab dang / yum dang / 'jig rten du bcas pa lha dang mis mthong ba thams cad dga' nas ngo mtshar rmad kyi sems skyes so //
translated: The father, mother, and all the gods and humans in the world were delighted and gave rise to thoughts of amazement and wonder.

original: mi thams cad kyis ni ngal bus ba chung ngur 'dzin te /
analyzed: mi thams cad kyis ni ngal bus ba chung ngur 'dzin te /
translated: All humans considered me to be a young child.

original: nga'i sku 'di ni bskal pa tshad med pa nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de lta bu dang bral lo //
analyzed: nga'i sku 'di ni bskal pa tshad med pa nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de lta bu dang bral lo //
translated: But this body of mine has been free from such afflictive phenomena for countless eons.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni chos kyi sku ste /
translated: The body of the Tathāgata is the body of Dharma.

original: sha dang / khrag dang / rgyus pa dang / rtsa dang / rus pa dang / rkang las bsgrubs pa'i lus ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: sha dang / khrag dang / rgyus pa dang / rtsa dang / rus pa dang / rkang las bsgrubs pa'i lus ma yin mod kyi /
translated: It is not a body composed of flesh, blood, sinews, bones, marrow, and bones.

original: 'jig rten pa'i rjes su bus pa chung ngu'i lus bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rjes su bus pa chung ngu'i lus bstan to //
translated: But in accordance with the world, I displayed the body of a young child.

original: lho phyogs su gom pa bdun por nas sems can tshad med pa la bla na med pa'i bsod nams kyi zhing mngon par bstan to //
analyzed: lho phyogs su gom pa bdun por nas sems can tshad med pa la bla na med pa'i bsod nams kyi zhing mngon par bstan to //
translated: He took seven steps to the south and revealed to countless beings the field of unsurpassed merit.

original: nub phyogs su gom pa bdun bor ba ni skye ba zad pa dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba med pa'i sku tha ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nub phyogs su gom pa bdun bor ba ni skye ba zad pa dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba med pa'i sku tha ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He took seven steps to the west in order to demonstrate the body that is the last to arise, that of one whose birth has come to an end and who is free from old age and death.

original: byang phyogs su gom pa bdun por ba ni srid pa'i 'khor ba thams cad las grol bar bstan to //
analyzed: byang phyogs su gom pa bdun por ba ni srid pa'i 'khor ba thams cad las grol bar bstan to //
translated: He took seven steps to the north in order to demonstrate the liberation from all the cycles of existence.

original: shar phyogs su gom pa bdun bor ba ni sems can gyi ston pa yin par mngon par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shar phyogs su gom pa bdun bor ba ni sems can gyi ston pa yin par mngon par bstan pa yin no //
translated: He took seven steps to the east in order to demonstrate that he is the teacher of beings.

original: phyogs mtshams bzhir gom pa bdun bdun bor ba ni /
analyzed: phyogs mtshams bzhir gom pa bdun bdun bor ba ni /
translated: He took seven steps in each of the four intermediate directions

original: nyon mongs pa rnam pa sna tshogs dang / bdung rnam bzhi yongs su bcom ste /🔽de bzhin @98b gshegs pa yang dag par rdzogs par mngon par sangs rgyas pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam pa sna tshogs dang / bdung rnam bzhi yongs su bcom ste / de bzhin @98b gshegs pa yang dag par rdzogs par mngon par sangs rgyas pa bstan pa'o //
translated: in order to demonstrate that he had conquered the four māras and the various afflictions.🔽He took seven steps above in order to demonstrate that he had attained the perfect enlightenment of the tathāgatas.

original: bla ma phyogs su gom pa bdun bor ba ni /
analyzed: bla ma phyogs su gom pa bdun bor ba ni /
translated: He took seven steps below in order to demonstrate that he had attained the perfect enlightenment of the tathāgatas.

original: gang mi gtsang ba'i dngos po thams cad gyis mi gos te /
analyzed: gang mi gtsang ba'i dngos po thams cad gyis mi gos te /
translated: He is not defiled by any impure thing,

original: nam mkha' lta bur gyur pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bur gyur pa bstan pa'o //
translated: like space.

original: 'og ma'i phyogs su gom pa bdun por ba ni /
analyzed: 'og ma'i phyogs su gom pa bdun por ba ni /
translated: He takes seven steps in the lower direction,

original: chos kyi char gyis sems can dmyal ba'i me bsad de /
analyzed: chos kyi char gyis sems can dmyal ba'i me bsad de /
translated: extinguishing the fires of the hells with the rain of the Dharma,

original: sems can de dag rab tu bde ba myong ba dang / tshul khrims ngan pa can la ba mo dang ser ba lta bu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems can de dag rab tu bde ba myong ba dang / tshul khrims ngan pa can la ba mo dang ser ba lta bu bstan pa'o //
translated: and causing those beings to experience great bliss.

original: dzambu'i gling du skyes nas zhag bdun lon pa dang / skra bregs pa bstan te /
analyzed: dzambu'i gling du skyes nas zhag bdun lon pa dang / skra bregs pa bstan te /
translated: He is born in Jambudvīpa, and after seven days have passed, he shows the tonsure,

original: mi thams cad kyis ni nga la bus par 'dzin to //
analyzed: mi thams cad kyis ni nga la bus par 'dzin to //
translated: and all people think, “He is my son.”

original: thog ma skra 'dreg pa na /
analyzed: thog ma skra 'dreg pa na /
translated: When he first shaves his hair,

original: 'jig rten du bcas pa lha dang / mi dang / bdung dang / tshangs pa dang / bram ze la sogs pa gang gis kyang /
analyzed: 'jig rten du bcas pa lha dang / mi dang / bdung dang / tshangs pa dang / bram ze la sogs pa gang gis kyang /
translated: no one in the world, whether gods, humans, asuras, Brahmā, brahmins, and so on,

original: nga'i spyi gtsug gi mtshan yang mthong bar mi nus na /
analyzed: nga'i spyi gtsug gi mtshan yang mthong bar mi nus na /
translated: is able to see the mark on the crown of his head.

original: gri thogs te nga'i skra 'dreg pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gri thogs te nga'i skra 'dreg pa lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to speak of those who, holding a knife, shave his hair?

original: gri thogs te nga'i spyi gtsug 'dreg pa ni gnas med do //
analyzed: gri thogs te nga'i spyi gtsug 'dreg pa ni gnas med do //
translated: It is impossible for me to cut my hair and beard.

original: nga yun ring po nas bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du skra dang kha spu bregs te /
analyzed: nga yun ring po nas bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du skra dang kha spu bregs te /
translated: For a long time, for countless eons, I have shaved my hair and beard.

original: nga'ang 'jig rten pa'i rjes su skra bregs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nga'ang 'jig rten pa'i rjes su skra bregs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: I also demonstrated shaving my hair in accordance with worldly customs.

original: nga thog ma bltams nas yab dang yum gyis nga lha la bstan pa'i phyir lha'i rten gyi nang du khrid nas /
analyzed: nga thog ma bltams nas yab dang yum gyis nga lha la bstan pa'i phyir lha'i rten gyi nang du khrid nas /
translated: When I was first born, my father and mother took me to a temple to show me to the gods.

original: lha dbang sgyur chen po la bstan pa na /
analyzed: lha dbang sgyur chen po la bstan pa na /
translated: When I was shown to Maheśvara,

original: lha dbang sgyur chen pos nga mthong ba'i tshe thal mo sbyar te bsti stang dang bcas pas phyogs gcig tu 'greng ngo //
analyzed: lha dbang sgyur chen pos nga mthong ba'i tshe thal mo sbyar te bsti stang dang bcas pas phyogs gcig tu 'greng ngo //
translated: when Maheśvara saw me, he joined his palms in respect and stood to one side.

original: nga ni yun ring po @99a *//
analyzed: nga ni yun ring po @99a *//
translated: For a long time,

original: nas bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du lha'i rten gyi nang du 'gro ba spangs mod kyi /
analyzed: nas bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du lha'i rten gyi nang du 'gro ba spangs mod kyi /
translated: for countless eons, I have abandoned going to temples.

original: 'jig rten pa'i rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir de'ang bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir de'ang bstan to //
translated: However, I also demonstrated that in accordance with worldly customs.

original: nga ni dzambu'i gling du rna ba phug pa'ang bstan te /
analyzed: nga ni dzambu'i gling du rna ba phug pa'ang bstan te /
translated: I also demonstrated having pierced ears in Jambudvīpa.

original: sems can thams cad kyis yang dag par nga'i rna ba dbug nus pa med de /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis yang dag par nga'i rna ba dbug nus pa med de /
translated: No sentient being can pierce my ears.

original: 'jig rten pa'i rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir de'ang mngon par bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir de'ang mngon par bstan to //
translated: I demonstrated this in order to conform with the world.

original: rin po che las rna cha seng ge can byas te /
analyzed: rin po che las rna cha seng ge can byas te /
translated: I had earrings made of jewels and gems,

original: nga'i rna ba la btags mod kyi /
analyzed: nga'i rna ba la btags mod kyi /
translated: and I had them attached to my ears.

original: nga ni bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du brgyan pa'i rgyan yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: nga ni bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du brgyan pa'i rgyan yongs su spangs te /
translated: But I had abandoned ornaments for immeasurable eons.

original: 'jig rten pa'i rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir de'ang bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir de'ang bstan to //
translated: I demonstrated this in order to conform with the world.

original: yi ge'i grvar yig rtsis kyang bslabs te /
analyzed: yi ge'i grvar yig rtsis kyang bslabs te /
translated: I studied writing and arithmetic in school.

original: nga ni bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pas khams gsum du brtags na sems can gang yang nga'i slob dpon du 'gyur ba med mod kyi /
analyzed: nga ni bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pas khams gsum du brtags na sems can gang yang nga'i slob dpon du 'gyur ba med mod kyi /
translated: But for immeasurable eons I had been endowed with perfection, and when I examined the three realms, there was no sentient being who could be my teacher.

original: 'jig rten pa'i rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir bslab pa'i grvar zhugs pa'ang bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir bslab pa'i grvar zhugs pa'ang bstan to //
translated: I demonstrated this in order to conform with the world.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: glang po che'i rkyal bslab pa dang / rta gdul ba dang / stobs rgol ba dang / nyam rtsal rnam pa sna tshogs sbyang ba'i bar du bstan to //
analyzed: glang po che'i rkyal bslab pa dang / rta gdul ba dang / stobs rgol ba dang / nyam rtsal rnam pa sna tshogs sbyang ba'i bar du bstan to //
translated: He demonstrated training in elephant riding, horse riding, archery, and various other skills.

original: dzambu'i gling du rgyal chab kyang bstan te /🔽sems can dag nga la rgyal tshab tu bzung nas /
analyzed: dzambu'i gling du rgyal chab kyang bstan te / sems can dag nga la rgyal tshab tu bzung nas /
translated: He also demonstrated the governance of Jambudvīpa.

original: 'dod pa lnga @99b la rab tu longs spyod par yang mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga @99b la rab tu longs spyod par yang mthong ngo //
translated: Sentient beings regarded him as their regent and saw him enjoying the five sense pleasures.

original: nga ni bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du 'dod pa lnga'i bde ba yongs su spangs mod kyi /
analyzed: nga ni bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du 'dod pa lnga'i bde ba yongs su spangs mod kyi /
translated: But I had already abandoned the pleasures of the five senses for countless eons.

original: 'jig rten pa'i rjes su de'ang bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rjes su de'ang bstan to //
translated: I demonstrated this in accordance with the world.

original: mtshan mkhan kyis nga'i mtshan bltas pa na /
analyzed: mtshan mkhan kyis nga'i mtshan bltas pa na /
translated: When the physiognomists examined my marks,

original: gal te rab tu ma byung na 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rab tu ma byung na 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por gyur te /
translated: they said that if I did not go forth, I would become a universal monarch.

original: dzambu'i gling la dbang bsgyur ro zhes sems can thams cad yid ches so; ;nga ni bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i thabs btang ste /
analyzed: dzambu'i gling la dbang bsgyur ro zhes sems can thams cad yid ches so; ;nga ni bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i thabs btang ste /
translated: All beings have confidence in me, saying, ‘He has dominion over the world.’

original: chos kyi 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por zhugs so //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por zhugs so //
translated: For countless eons I have given up the position of a universal monarch and have become a Dharma king.

original: dzambu'i gling na bud med mang po dang / 'dod pa lnga spangs te /
analyzed: dzambu'i gling na bud med mang po dang / 'dod pa lnga spangs te /
translated: In the world I have given up the many women and the five desires,

original: rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / dge sbyong mthong nas rab tu byung ba bstan pas sems can thams cad kyis rgyal tshab bzang sbyin gdod rab tu 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / dge sbyong mthong nas rab tu byung ba bstan pas sems can thams cad kyis rgyal tshab bzang sbyin gdod rab tu 'byung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: and I have shown aging, sickness, death, and the sight of ascetics. All beings say, ‘The crown prince Bhadradatta will go forth.’

original: nga ni bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du rab tu byung ste lam bsgoms kyang /
analyzed: nga ni bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du rab tu byung ste lam bsgoms kyang /
translated: For countless eons I have gone forth and cultivated the path,

original: 'jig rten pa'i rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir de'ang mngon par bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir de'ang mngon par bstan to //
translated: but in order to accord with the world I have also shown that.

original: ngas dzambu'i gling du khyim nas khyim ma yin par rab tu byung nas bsnyen par rdzogs te lam la shin tu nan tan byas pas /
analyzed: ngas dzambu'i gling du khyim nas khyim ma yin par rab tu byung nas bsnyen par rdzogs te lam la shin tu nan tan byas pas /
translated: I have shown that in the world I went forth from home to homelessness, that I have become fully ordained, that I have practiced the path with great earnestness,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir ldog pa'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i bar du thob pa bstan to //🔽so so'i skye bo dag ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu @100a *//
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir ldog pa'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i bar du thob pa bstan to // so so'i skye bo dag ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu @100a *//
translated: and that I have attained the fruit of stream-entry, the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of nonreturning, and the fruit of arahantship.

original: thob par mi dka' ste /
analyzed: thob par mi dka' ste /
translated: But it is not difficult for ordinary people to attain the fruit of arahantship.

original: sla ba zhig go snyam du sems so //
analyzed: sla ba zhig go snyam du sems so //
translated: They think that it is easy.

original: nga ni bskal pa grangs med pa'i snga rol du dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob kyang sems can gdul pa'i phyir de'ang bstan to //
analyzed: nga ni bskal pa grangs med pa'i snga rol du dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob kyang sems can gdul pa'i phyir de'ang bstan to //
translated: But although I attained the fruit of arahantship countless eons ago, I have shown this in order to discipline beings.

original: snying po byang chub kyi shing drung du rtsa bting ba la 'dug nas bdud kyi ris rnams btul te /
analyzed: snying po byang chub kyi shing drung du rtsa bting ba la 'dug nas bdud kyi ris rnams btul te /
translated: Sitting cross-legged on the grass beneath the Bodhi tree, I subdued the hosts of Mara.

original: so so'i skye bo dag ni ngas gdod snying po byang chub kyi shing drung du bdud kyi ris rnams btul snyam sems te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dag ni ngas gdod snying po byang chub kyi shing drung du bdud kyi ris rnams btul snyam sems te /
translated: Ordinary people think, “I will first subdue the hosts of Māra at the foot of the tree of awakening.”

original: nga ni bskal pa grangs med pa'i snga rol du bdud thams cad btul zin mod kyi /
analyzed: nga ni bskal pa grangs med pa'i snga rol du bdud thams cad btul zin mod kyi /
translated: But I have already subdued all Māras long before the beginning of the incalculable eon.

original: sems can ma dul ba dag gdul ba'i phyir bdud btul ba de'ang mngon par bstan to //
analyzed: sems can ma dul ba dag gdul ba'i phyir bdud btul ba de'ang mngon par bstan to //
translated: However, in order to tame the untamed beings, I have also demonstrated the subduing of Māra.

original: ngas ni bshang gci che chung dang / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba'ang bstan pas so so'i skye bo dag ni nga la bshang gci che chung dang / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba yod snyam sems te /
analyzed: ngas ni bshang gci che chung dang / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba'ang bstan pas so so'i skye bo dag ni nga la bshang gci che chung dang / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba yod snyam sems te /
translated: I have also demonstrated the passing of great and small stools and the exhalation and inhalation of breath. Ordinary people think, “He has great and small stools and he exhales and inhales.”

original: nga'i sku 'di bsod nams kyi 'bras bu yin pas de lta bu'i bshang gci che chung dang / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba'i bag med kyang 'jig rten pa'i rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir de'ang mngon par bstan to //
analyzed: nga'i sku 'di bsod nams kyi 'bras bu yin pas de lta bu'i bshang gci che chung dang / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba'i bag med kyang 'jig rten pa'i rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir de'ang mngon par bstan to //
translated: But since this body of mine is the result of merit, I am free from such things as great and small stools and exhalation and inhalation of breath. However, in order to conform with the world, I have also demonstrated that.

original: ngas ni pha rol pos sbyin pa byin pa blangs pa'ang bstan te /
analyzed: ngas ni pha rol pos sbyin pa byin pa blangs pa'ang bstan te /
translated: I also show myself receiving gifts from others.

original: nga'i sku 'di la ni bkres pa'am skom pa'i bag med do //
analyzed: nga'i sku 'di la ni bkres pa'am skom pa'i bag med do //
translated: But this body of mine has no hunger or thirst.

original: 'on kyang 'jig rten pa'i rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir de'ang mngon par bstan to //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig rten pa'i rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir de'ang mngon par bstan to //
translated: Nevertheless, I show myself doing these things in order to conform with the world.

original: gzhan yang so so'i skye bo dang mthun par nyal ba dang gnyid log pa'ang bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan yang so so'i skye bo dang mthun par nyal ba dang gnyid log pa'ang bstan te /
translated: Moreover, I show myself sleeping and lying down in conformity with ordinary people.

original: nga ni bskal pa grangs @100b med pa'i bar du shin tu zab mo'i shes rab dang ldan te /
analyzed: nga ni bskal pa grangs @100b med pa'i bar du shin tu zab mo'i shes rab dang ldan te /
translated: For countless eons I have possessed profound wisdom.

original: srid pa gsum dang yongs su bral yang /🔽'gro ba dang / sdod pa dang / spyod lam dang / klad pa na ba dang / lto na ba dang / rgyab na ba dang / 'brum bu dang / bkrus pa dang / rkang pa 'khru ba dang / lag pa 'khru ba dang / gdong 'khru ba dang /
analyzed: srid pa gsum dang yongs su bral yang / 'gro ba dang / sdod pa dang / spyod lam dang / klad pa na ba dang / lto na ba dang / rgyab na ba dang / 'brum bu dang / bkrus pa dang / rkang pa 'khru ba dang / lag pa 'khru ba dang / gdong 'khru ba dang /
translated: I am completely free from the three realms of existence.🔽I show myself walking, standing, sitting, lying down, having a headache, having a stomachache, having back pain, having boils, bathing, washing my feet, washing my hands, washing my face,

original: kha 'khru ba dang / so shing 'cha' ba'i bar du bstan te /
analyzed: kha 'khru ba dang / so shing 'cha' ba'i bar du bstan te /
translated: and even chewing tooth wood.

original: so so'i skye bo dag ni nga la de dag kun yod do zhes sems te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dag ni nga la de dag kun yod do zhes sems te /
translated: Ordinary people think that I have all of those,

original: nga'i sku la ni de dag gang yang med do //
analyzed: nga'i sku la ni de dag gang yang med do //
translated: but my body has none of them.

original: nga'i zhabs padmo ltar yongs su dag cing zhal gyi dri me tog autpal bro mang so so'i skye bo dag ni nga la gang zag snyam du sems te /
analyzed: nga'i zhabs padmo ltar yongs su dag cing zhal gyi dri me tog autpal bro mang so so'i skye bo dag ni nga la gang zag snyam du sems te /
translated: My feet are completely pure like lotuses, and the fragrance of my mouth is like a multitude of utpala flowers. Ordinary people think of me as a person,

original: yang dag par na nga ni gang zag ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par na nga ni gang zag ma yin no //
translated: but in reality I am not a person.

original: nga'ang tshem bu gyon cing 'khru ba dang / 'tshed pa dang / 'chag par bstan te /
analyzed: nga'ang tshem bu gyon cing 'khru ba dang / 'tshed pa dang / 'chag par bstan te /
translated: I also show myself wearing patched robes, washing, cooking, and walking.

original: nga ni sngon yun ring po nas gos mi dgos par gyur to //
analyzed: nga ni sngon yun ring po nas gos mi dgos par gyur to //
translated: But in reality I have been without the need for clothing for a long time.

original: so so'i skye bo dag ni sgra gcan 'dzin la nga'i bu snyam /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dag ni sgra gcan 'dzin la nga'i bu snyam /
translated: Ordinary people think of Rāhula as my son,

original: rgyal po zas gtsang ma ni nga'i yab snyam /
analyzed: rgyal po zas gtsang ma ni nga'i yab snyam /
translated: King Śuddhodana as my father,

original: lha mdzes ni yum snyam /
analyzed: lha mdzes ni yum snyam /
translated: and Māyā as my mother.

original: 'jig rten gyi bde ba la'ang longs spyad nas dngos po de dag thams cad btang ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi bde ba la'ang longs spyad nas dngos po de dag thams cad btang ste /
translated: Having enjoyed worldly pleasures, I gave up all those things,

original: rab tu byung nas lam la nan tan du byed do snyam sems so //
analyzed: rab tu byung nas lam la nan tan du byed do snyam sems so //
translated: went forth, and practiced the path.

original: gzhan yang kha cig ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang kha cig ni /
translated: Moreover, some think:

original: rgyal po chen po'i rgyal tshab thu bo goo ta ma'i rigs chen po la gtogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bde ba thams cad spangs nas 'jig rten las 'da' ba'i chos tshol lo snyam ste /🔽nga ni yun @101a *//
analyzed: rgyal po chen po'i rgyal tshab thu bo goo ta ma'i rigs chen po la gtogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bde ba thams cad spangs nas 'jig rten las 'da' ba'i chos tshol lo snyam ste / nga ni yun @101a *//
translated: “He is the eldest son of the great king, belonging to the great family of Gautama. He has abandoned all worldly pleasures and seeks the supramundane Dharma.”

original: ring po nas 'jig rten gyi 'dod pa'i dngos po thams cad yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: ring po nas 'jig rten gyi 'dod pa'i dngos po thams cad yongs su spangs te /
translated: I have long abandoned all worldly desirable things.

original: de dag thams cad ni bstan pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni bstan pa tsam du zad do //
translated: All of that is merely a show.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: nga ni dzambu'i gling 'dir yang dang yang mya ngan las 'das pa bstan kyang /
analyzed: nga ni dzambu'i gling 'dir yang dang yang mya ngan las 'das pa bstan kyang /
translated: I have repeatedly displayed the transcendence of suffering in this Jambudvīpa,

original: mthar yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mthar yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin te /
translated: but in the end I do not pass into parinirvāṇa.

original: so so'i skye bo dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par 'gog pa zad do snyam ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par 'gog pa zad do snyam ste /
translated: Ordinary beings think, ‘The Tathāgata’s true cessation is exhausted.’

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni mthar zad pa ma yin pas rtag tu gnas pa'i chos can /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni mthar zad pa ma yin pas rtag tu gnas pa'i chos can /
translated: But the Tathāgata is not ultimately exhausted, so he should be known as one who always abides,

original: mi 'gyur mi 'pho ba'i chos can du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur mi 'pho ba'i chos can du rig par bya'o //
translated: one whose nature is unchanging and unmoving.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called “great nirvāṇa”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: is the realm of reality of the blessed buddhas.

original: gzhan yang ngas dzambu'i gling 'dir 'jig rten du mngon par 'byung ba bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan yang ngas dzambu'i gling 'dir 'jig rten du mngon par 'byung ba bstan te /
translated: Moreover, I have demonstrated the appearance in the world in this Jambudvīpa.

original: so so'i skye bo dag ni nga gdod mngon par sangs rgyas so snyam sems te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dag ni nga gdod mngon par sangs rgyas so snyam sems te /
translated: Ordinary people think, “He has just now attained full awakening.”

original: nga ni bskal pa grangs med pa'i bar du bya ba thams cad byas kyang 'jig rten pa'i rjes su dzambu'i gling 'dir gdod mngon par sangs rgyas pa bstan to //
analyzed: nga ni bskal pa grangs med pa'i bar du bya ba thams cad byas kyang 'jig rten pa'i rjes su dzambu'i gling 'dir gdod mngon par sangs rgyas pa bstan to //
translated: Although I have performed all the deeds for an immeasurable number of eons, I have demonstrated the attainment of full awakening in this Jambudvīpa in accordance with the world.

original: nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir tshul khrims ma bsdams te rtsa ba bzhi'ang nyams pa bstan pas so so'i skye bo dag ni yang dag par ngas tshul khrims nyams so snyam du sems kyang /
analyzed: nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir tshul khrims ma bsdams te rtsa ba bzhi'ang nyams pa bstan pas so so'i skye bo dag ni yang dag par ngas tshul khrims nyams so snyam du sems kyang /
translated: I have also demonstrated in this Jambudvīpa the violation of morality and the transgression of the four roots, and so ordinary people think, “He has violated morality.”

original: nga ni bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du tshul khrims bsrungs pa la nyams pa med do //
analyzed: nga ni bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du tshul khrims bsrungs pa la nyams pa med do //
translated: But I have maintained morality for an immeasurable number of eons without transgression.

original: @101b nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir log sred can du bstan te /
analyzed: @101b nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir log sred can du bstan te /
translated: I also demonstrated the act of turning my back on the world in this Rose Apple Continent.

original: so so'i skye bo dag ni thams cad kyis nga la log sred can yin par sems kyang /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dag ni thams cad kyis nga la log sred can yin par sems kyang /
translated: Although all ordinary beings think that I turned my back on the world,

original: nga ni yang dag par log sred can ma yin no //
analyzed: nga ni yang dag par log sred can ma yin no //
translated: I did not truly turn my back on the world.

original: gal te log sred can yin na /
analyzed: gal te log sred can yin na /
translated: If I had turned my back on the world,

original: ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas par gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas par gyur /
translated: how could I have attained perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir dge 'dun 'dum pa'i dbyen byas pa bstan te /
analyzed: nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir dge 'dun 'dum pa'i dbyen byas pa bstan te /
translated: I also demonstrated the act of causing a schism in the saṅgha in this Rose Apple Continent.

original: so so'i skye bo dag ni nga la dge 'dun 'dum pa'i dbyen byas so snyam du sems kyang /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dag ni nga la dge 'dun 'dum pa'i dbyen byas so snyam du sems kyang /
translated: Although ordinary beings think that I caused a schism in the saṅgha,

original: ngas rnam par bltas na 'jig rten du bcas pa lha dang mi'i nang na dge 'dun 'dum pa'i dbyen byed nus pa ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: ngas rnam par bltas na 'jig rten du bcas pa lha dang mi'i nang na dge 'dun 'dum pa'i dbyen byed nus pa ma mthong ngo //
translated: when I looked around I did not see anyone in the world, including the gods and humans, who could cause a schism in the saṅgha.

original: nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir dam pa'i chos yongs su srung ba bstan te /
analyzed: nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir dam pa'i chos yongs su srung ba bstan te /
translated: I also demonstrated the act of protecting the true Dharma in this Rose Apple Continent.

original: so so'i skye bo dag ni nga la chos srung ba yin no snyam nas /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dag ni nga la chos srung ba yin no snyam nas /
translated: Ordinary people think that I am protecting the Dharma.

original: thams cad ngo mtshar du gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad ngo mtshar du gyur te /
translated: They are all amazed.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos nyid de yin pas de la ni ngo mtshar du mi bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos nyid de yin pas de la ni ngo mtshar du mi bya'o //
translated: But that is the nature of the Buddhas, and so one should not be amazed by it.

original: nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir bdud sdig to can gyi lus su bstan te /
analyzed: nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir bdud sdig to can gyi lus su bstan te /
translated: I also appear in this world of Jambudvīpa in the body of Māra, the evil one.

original: so so'i skye bo dag ni yang dag par nga la bdud sdig to can yin no zhes sems kyang /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dag ni yang dag par nga la bdud sdig to can yin no zhes sems kyang /
translated: Ordinary people think that I am really Māra, the evil one.

original: nga ni bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du bdud kyi las dang yongs su bral te /
analyzed: nga ni bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du bdud kyi las dang yongs su bral te /
translated: But for countless eons I have been free from the actions of Māra.

original: padmo ltar yongs su dag pa la 'go ba med do //
analyzed: padmo ltar yongs su dag pa la 'go ba med do //
translated: I am as pure as a lotus flower, and I am not defiled.

original: nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir bud med kyi lus kyis sangs rgyas pa bstan te /
analyzed: nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir bud med kyi lus kyis sangs rgyas pa bstan te /
translated: I also appear in this world of Jambudvīpa in the body of a woman.

original: so so'i skye bo dag ni 'di ltar ngo mtshar che ste /🔽bud med kyis bla na med pa yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par @102a *//
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dag ni 'di ltar ngo mtshar che ste / bud med kyis bla na med pa yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par @102a *//
translated: Ordinary people think that this is amazing.

original: sangs rgyas so snyam sems te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas so snyam sems te /
translated: They think, ‘A woman has attained supreme awakening and has become a Buddha.’

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni nam du bud med kyi lus mi len kyang sems can tshad med pa snyed gdul ba'i phyir bud med kyi gzugs su bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni nam du bud med kyi lus mi len kyang sems can tshad med pa snyed gdul ba'i phyir bud med kyi gzugs su bstan to //
translated: The Tathāgata never again takes on a female body, but in order to convert countless sentient beings, he manifests in the form of a woman.

original: sems can thams cad la thugs brtse ba'i phyir gzugs byad rnam pa sna tshogs bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la thugs brtse ba'i phyir gzugs byad rnam pa sna tshogs bstan pa yin no //
translated: Out of compassion for all sentient beings, he manifests in various forms.

original: nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir lam rgyud bzhir skye ba bstan te /
analyzed: nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir lam rgyud bzhir skye ba bstan te /
translated: I too, in this Jambudvīpa, manifest birth in the four modes of birth.

original: nga ni yun ring po nam lam gyi rgyud du 'gyur ba'i rgyun bcad do //
analyzed: nga ni yun ring po nam lam gyi rgyud du 'gyur ba'i rgyun bcad do //
translated: I long ago cut off the continuum of birth in the four modes of birth.

original: las kyi rgyus lam rgyud bzhir lhung nas sems can de dag gdul ba'i phyir de dag tu skye pa'ang mngon par bstan to //
analyzed: las kyi rgyus lam rgyud bzhir lhung nas sems can de dag gdul ba'i phyir de dag tu skye pa'ang mngon par bstan to //
translated: But due to the causes of karma, I fall into the four modes of birth, and in order to convert those sentient beings, I manifest birth among them.

original: nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir tshangs pa'i lha'i rgyal po byas te /
analyzed: nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir tshangs pa'i lha'i rgyal po byas te /
translated: I too, in this Jambudvīpa, become the king of the Brahmā gods.

original: gang tshangs pa'i lha la rjed pa dag yang dag pa'i chos la dgod pa'i phyir gyi /
analyzed: gang tshangs pa'i lha la rjed pa dag yang dag pa'i chos la dgod pa'i phyir gyi /
translated: In order to establish those who worship the Brahmā gods in the true Dharma,

original: yang dag par tshangs pa ni ma yin yang so so'i skye bo dag ni nga la yang dag par tshangs pa'i lha'i rgyal po snyam sems te /
analyzed: yang dag par tshangs pa ni ma yin yang so so'i skye bo dag ni nga la yang dag par tshangs pa'i lha'i rgyal po snyam sems te /
translated: “Although I am not a true Brahmā, ordinary beings think of me as the king of the gods of the Brahmakāyika realm.🔽I also manifest in the form of a god to other gods.

original: lha'i gzugs su lha gzhan dag tu bstan pa'ang de bzhin no; ;nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir bud med sbrul 'tshong ma'i gnas su 'gro ba bstan te /
analyzed: lha'i gzugs su lha gzhan dag tu bstan pa'ang de bzhin no; ;nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir bud med sbrul 'tshong ma'i gnas su 'gro ba bstan te /
translated: I also manifest in this world of Jambudvīpa as a woman in a brothel.

original: nga la ni yang dag par 'dod chags pa'i 'du shes med la /🔽padmo ltar yongs su dag cing cis kyang mi 'go'ang sems can gang 'dod chags kyis zil gyis non pa dag /
analyzed: nga la ni yang dag par 'dod chags pa'i 'du shes med la / padmo ltar yongs su dag cing cis kyang mi 'go'ang sems can gang 'dod chags kyis zil gyis non pa dag /
translated: I have no perception of true desire.🔽I am as pure as a lotus and am not stained by anything.

original: lam srang bzhi mdor dam pa'i chos bstan pa'i phyir gyi /
analyzed: lam srang bzhi mdor dam pa'i chos bstan pa'i phyir gyi /
translated: I do this in order to teach the Dharma in the middle of the crossroads for those beings who are overcome by desire.

original: nga la yang dag par @102b 'dod chags kyi sems med kyang /
analyzed: nga la yang dag par @102b 'dod chags kyi sems med kyang /
translated: I have no mind of true desire.

original: so so'i skye bo dag ni nga la bud med kyi dbang byed do snyam sems so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dag ni nga la bud med kyi dbang byed do snyam sems so //
translated: Ordinary beings think that I am under the power of women.”

original: nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir gos sngon po gyon pa'i rigs su 'gro ba bstan te; de'ang bran mor gyur pa yang dag pa'i chos la dgod pa'i phyir gyi /
analyzed: nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir gos sngon po gyon pa'i rigs su 'gro ba bstan te; de'ang bran mor gyur pa yang dag pa'i chos la dgod pa'i phyir gyi /
translated: I also appear in this world as a member of the caste that wears blue garments, in order to establish in the true Dharma even those who are servants.

original: nga la ni yang dag par gos sngon po gyon pa'i gnas su ltung ba'i las med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nga la ni yang dag par gos sngon po gyon pa'i gnas su ltung ba'i las med par rig par bya'o //
translated: But you should know that I have no karma that would cause me to fall into the state of wearing blue garments.

original: nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir slob dpon lta bur bstan te /
analyzed: nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir slob dpon lta bur bstan te /
translated: I also appear in this world as a teacher,

original: bus pa gzhon nu shed ma bye ba yang dag pa'i chos la dgod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bus pa gzhon nu shed ma bye ba yang dag pa'i chos la dgod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to establish in the true Dharma even young children who have not yet reached maturity.

original: nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir chang 'thung ba dang / rgyal po'i gnas dang / pham rgyal gyi phyir 'thab mo byas pa'ang bstan te /
analyzed: nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir chang 'thung ba dang / rgyal po'i gnas dang / pham rgyal gyi phyir 'thab mo byas pa'ang bstan te /
translated: I also appear in this world as a drunkard, and as one who engages in the king’s work and in battles for the sake of victory or defeat.

original: de'ang sems can de dag gdul zhing bsgral ba'i phyir gyi /
analyzed: de'ang sems can de dag gdul zhing bsgral ba'i phyir gyi /
translated: But this is in order to convert and liberate those beings.

original: nga la ni de lta bu'i las ngan pa med kyang so so'i skye bo dag ni nga la de lta bu'i las kyang byed do snyam sems so //
analyzed: nga la ni de lta bu'i las ngan pa med kyang so so'i skye bo dag ni nga la de lta bu'i las kyang byed do snyam sems so //
translated: Although I have no such bad karma, ordinary people think that I do.

original: nga'ang yun ring por dur khrod na bya rgod kyi lus su bstan te /
analyzed: nga'ang yun ring por dur khrod na bya rgod kyi lus su bstan te /
translated: I have also appeared for a long time in the charnel grounds in the form of a vulture.

original: de'ang bya thams cad bsgral ba'i phyir gyi /
analyzed: de'ang bya thams cad bsgral ba'i phyir gyi /
translated: This was in order to liberate all birds.

original: so so'i skye bo dag ni nga la yang dag par bya rgod kyi lus su sems te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dag ni nga la yang dag par bya rgod kyi lus su sems te /
translated: Ordinary beings, however, think of me as a real vulture.

original: nga ni yun ring po nas las de lta bu dang bral yang bya rnams bsgral ba'i phyir de'ang mngon par bstan to //🔽nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir sems can tshad med pa gdul zhing /
analyzed: nga ni yun ring po nas las de lta bu dang bral yang bya rnams bsgral ba'i phyir de'ang mngon par bstan to // nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir sems can tshad med pa gdul zhing /
translated: Although I have been free of such actions for a long time, I have manifested in this way in order to liberate the birds.

original: dam pa'i chos la dgod pa'i phyir khyim bdag gi lus kyang bstan to //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos la dgod pa'i phyir khyim bdag gi lus kyang bstan to //
translated: I have also appeared in the form of a householder in this Jambudvīpa in order to tame countless beings and establish them in the sacred Dharma.

original: gzhan yang rgyal po dang / blon po dang / rgyal bu dang / blon po chen por gyur @103a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyal po dang / blon po dang / rgyal bu dang / blon po chen por gyur @103a *//
translated: I have also been a king, a minister, a prince, and a great minister.

original: te; de dag kun tu'ang gtso bo dang phul du gyur cing /
analyzed: te; de dag kun tu'ang gtso bo dang phul du gyur cing /
translated: In all these cases, I have been the foremost and the best.

original: dam pa'i chos la nan tan bya ba'i phyir rgyal po'i thabs su'ang zhugs so //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos la nan tan bya ba'i phyir rgyal po'i thabs su'ang zhugs so //
translated: I have also taken up the position of a king in order to be diligent in the sacred Dharma.

original: nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir nad kyi bskal pa byung nas /
analyzed: nga'ang dzambu'i gling 'dir nad kyi bskal pa byung nas /
translated: I have also appeared in this Jambudvīpa during an age of disease.

original: sems can mang po nad kyis rnam par gzir bdag sman gyis gsos te /
analyzed: sems can mang po nad kyis rnam par gzir bdag sman gyis gsos te /
translated: When many sentient beings are afflicted by disease, I will heal them with medicine.

original: de'i 'og tu dam pa'i chos bstan nas bla na med pa'i byang chub la bkod de /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dam pa'i chos bstan nas bla na med pa'i byang chub la bkod de /
translated: After that, I will teach them the sublime Dharma and establish them in unsurpassed awakening.

original: so so'i skye bo dag ni nad kyi bskal pa byung snyam sems so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dag ni nad kyi bskal pa byung snyam sems so //
translated: Ordinary beings will think that the age of disease has arrived.

original: gzhan yang dzambu'i gling 'dir mu ge'i bskal pa byung ba na /
analyzed: gzhan yang dzambu'i gling 'dir mu ge'i bskal pa byung ba na /
translated: Moreover, when a famine arises in this world,

original: de dag ci 'dod pa bzhin bza' ba dang btung ba byin nas gdod dam pa'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: de dag ci 'dod pa bzhin bza' ba dang btung ba byin nas gdod dam pa'i chos bstan te /
translated: I will give them food and drink according to their wishes and then teach them the sublime Dharma.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub la bkod do //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub la bkod do //
translated: I will establish them in unsurpassed awakening.

original: gzhan yang dzambu'i gling 'dir mtshon gyi bskal pa byung ba na /
analyzed: gzhan yang dzambu'i gling 'dir mtshon gyi bskal pa byung ba na /
translated: Moreover, when a war arises in this world,

original: de la dam pa'i chos bstan te /
analyzed: de la dam pa'i chos bstan te /
translated: I will teach them the sublime Dharma.

original: dgrar 'khon du 'dzin pa spangs nas /
analyzed: dgrar 'khon du 'dzin pa spangs nas /
translated: They will abandon their enmity and

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub la bkod do //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub la bkod do //
translated: I will establish them in unsurpassed awakening.

original: gzhan yang rtag par 'dzin pa dag la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes bstan pa dang / bde bar 'du shes pa la sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes bstan pa dang / bdag tu 'du shes pa dag la bdag med par bstan pa dang / yongs su dag par 'du shes pa dag la yongs su ma dag pa'i 'du shes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang rtag par 'dzin pa dag la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes bstan pa dang / bde bar 'du shes pa la sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes bstan pa dang / bdag tu 'du shes pa dag la bdag med par bstan pa dang / yongs su dag par 'du shes pa dag la yongs su ma dag pa'i 'du shes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is in order to teach the perception of impermanence to those who grasp at permanence, to teach the perception of suffering to those who perceive happiness, to teach selflessness to those who perceive a self, and to teach impurity to those who perceive purity.

original: sems can gang zhig khams gsum la chags na de la dam pa'i chos bstan te gnas de spong bar @103b byed do //
analyzed: sems can gang zhig khams gsum la chags na de la dam pa'i chos bstan te gnas de spong bar @103b byed do //
translated: If there are sentient beings attached to the three realms, the true Dharma is taught to them so that they may abandon those states.

original: sems can gdul zhing bsgral ba'i phyir bla na med pa'i dam pa'i chos sman lta bu ston to //
analyzed: sems can gdul zhing bsgral ba'i phyir bla na med pa'i dam pa'i chos sman lta bu ston to //
translated: In order to train and liberate sentient beings, the unsurpassed true Dharma is taught, like medicine.

original: kun tu nyon mongs pa'i shing thams cad gcad pa'i phyir bla na med pa'i chos kyi sman gyi shing bskyed do //
analyzed: kun tu nyon mongs pa'i shing thams cad gcad pa'i phyir bla na med pa'i chos kyi sman gyi shing bskyed do //
translated: In order to cut down the trees of all afflictions, the unsurpassed medicinal tree of the Dharma is planted.

original: mu stegs can gyi chos rnams gdul zhing bsgral ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i chos ston to //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi chos rnams gdul zhing bsgral ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i chos ston to //
translated: In order to train and liberate the teachings of the tīrthikas, the true Dharma is taught.

original: sems can thams cad kyi ston par mngon par bstan kyang thog ma nas sems can gyi ston pa'o snyam du mi dgongs so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi ston par mngon par bstan kyang thog ma nas sems can gyi ston pa'o snyam du mi dgongs so //
translated: He manifests himself as the teacher of all sentient beings, but he does not think, “From the beginning, I am the teacher of sentient beings.”

original: bus pa ma rabs bsgral ba'i phyir de dag tu 'gro ba'ang mngon par ston te /
analyzed: bus pa ma rabs bsgral ba'i phyir de dag tu 'gro ba'ang mngon par ston te /
translated: He manifests himself going to those places in order to liberate the childish and the wicked.

original: chos bstan pa'i phyir gyi /
analyzed: chos bstan pa'i phyir gyi /
translated: He does so in order to teach the Dharma,

original: las ngan pas de'i lus len pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: las ngan pas de'i lus len pa ni ma yin no //
translated: not because he has taken on a bad destiny.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni de ltar yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la bde bar gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni de ltar yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la bde bar gnas pa ste /
translated: The Tathāgata, the Perfectly Awakened One, is thus situated in the Great Nirvāṇa.

original: de bas na rtag tu gnas pa mi 'gyur ba'i chos can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rtag tu gnas pa mi 'gyur ba'i chos can zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is said to be “always situated, immutable.”

original: ji ltar dzambu'i gling ltar shar gyi lus 'phags gling dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan yang de bzhin du rgyas par ro //
analyzed: ji ltar dzambu'i gling ltar shar gyi lus 'phags gling dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan yang de bzhin du rgyas par ro //
translated: Just as Jambudvīpa, so too is Videha in the east, Godānīya in the west, and Kuru in the north.

original: gling bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: gling bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyang de bzhin te /
translated: Just as the continents, so too is the trichiliocosm.

original: srid pa nyi shu lnga po ni ji ltar dpa' bar 'gro ba'i mdo las rgyas par bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: srid pa nyi shu lnga po ni ji ltar dpa' bar 'gro ba'i mdo las rgyas par bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: The twenty-five forms of existence are as extensively taught in the Heroic Progress Scripture.

original: don de lta bas na yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don de lta bas na yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of this meaning, it is called the Great Nirvana.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang @104a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang @104a *//
translated: If a bodhisattva-mahasattva

original: zhig yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la bde bar gnas na mngon par shes pa'i rdzu 'phrul 'di lta bu ston pa la 'jigs pa med do //
analyzed: zhig yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la bde bar gnas na mngon par shes pa'i rdzu 'phrul 'di lta bu ston pa la 'jigs pa med do //
translated: dwells happily in the Great Nirvana, he will have no fear in demonstrating such supernormal knowledge and miracles.

original: 'od srung; rkyen da lta bas na khyod kyis sgra gcan 'dzin la sangs rgyas kyi sras yin no zhes ma zer cig /
analyzed: 'od srung; rkyen da lta bas na khyod kyis sgra gcan 'dzin la sangs rgyas kyi sras yin no zhes ma zer cig /
translated: Kasyapa, because of this condition, you should not say that Rahula is the Buddha's son.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: ngas sngon bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du srid pa'i 'dod pa dang bral bas de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag tu gnas pa'i chos can mi 'gyur mi 'pho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ngas sngon bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du srid pa'i 'dod pa dang bral bas de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag tu gnas pa'i chos can mi 'gyur mi 'pho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because I have been free from the desires of existence for immeasurable eons, therefore the Tathagata is said to be one who always abides by the Dharma, unchanging and immutable.

original: 'od srung gis yang gsol pa /
analyzed: 'od srung gis yang gsol pa /
translated: Kasyapa then said, World-Honored One, if the Tathagata is always abiding by the Dharma, unchanging and immutable, then why does the Tathagata say that he will enter extinction?

original: ci'i slad du de bzhin gshegs pa la rtag tu gnas pa'i chos can zhes bgyi /
analyzed: ci'i slad du de bzhin gshegs pa la rtag tu gnas pa'i chos can zhes bgyi /
translated: Why is the Tathāgata called one who always abides by the Dharma?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ltar na me mar gum nas gnas dang phyogs kyang ma mchis pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ltar na me mar gum nas gnas dang phyogs kyang ma mchis pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: As the Buddha has said, when a candle is extinguished, it has no location or direction. The Tathāgata is also like this.

original: mya ngan las 'das nas gnas dang phyogs ma mchis pa'ang de bzhin no zhes ma gsungs sam /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das nas gnas dang phyogs ma mchis pa'ang de bzhin no zhes ma gsungs sam /
translated: After nirvāṇa, he has no location or direction.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od srung la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od srung la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said to Kāśyapa:

original: rigs kyi bu khyod 'di skad du ji ltar me mar shi na gnas dang phyogs med pa bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod 'di skad du ji ltar me mar shi na gnas dang phyogs med pa bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: “Son of noble family, do not say that just as when a candle is extinguished, it has no location or direction, so the Tathāgata is also like this.

original: mya ngan las 'das nas gnas dang phyogs kyang med do //🔽zhes ma zer cig /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das nas gnas dang phyogs kyang med do // zhes ma zer cig /
translated: After nirvāṇa, he has no location or direction.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / skyes pa'am bud med gcig me mar 'dzugs na /
analyzed: dper na / skyes pa'am bud med gcig me mar 'dzugs na /
translated: if a man or woman were to light a candle,

original: mar gyi snod che chung las mar gyis bkang ste gzugs @104b so //
analyzed: mar gyi snod che chung las mar gyis bkang ste gzugs @104b so //
translated: the candle would burn according to the size of the vessel filled with oil.

original: ji srid mar yod kyi bar du ni snang ba'ang yod do //
analyzed: ji srid mar yod kyi bar du ni snang ba'ang yod do //
translated: As long as there is oil, the light will remain.

original: ci ste mar zad na snang ba'ang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste mar zad na snang ba'ang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the oil is exhausted, the light will disappear.

original: snang ba med par gyur pa ni nyon mongs pa zad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: snang ba med par gyur pa ni nyon mongs pa zad pa lta bu'o //
translated: The disappearance of the light is like the exhaustion of the passions.

original: snang ba zad de med par song yang me mar gyi snod med par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: snang ba zad de med par song yang me mar gyi snod med par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Even though the light is exhausted and disappears, the lamp-vessel is not destroyed.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The Tathagata is like this.

original: nyon mongs pa zad de med kyang chos kyi sku ni rtag tu yod do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zad de med kyang chos kyi sku ni rtag tu yod do //
translated: Even though the passions are exhausted and no more, the Dharma body is always present.

original: rigs kyi bu khyod kyi yid la ji snyam snang ba dang / me mar gyi snod cig car med par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod kyi yid la ji snyam snang ba dang / me mar gyi snod cig car med par 'gyur ram /
translated: Son of good family, do you think that the light and the lamp-vessel disappear at the same time?

original: 'od srung gis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'od srung gis gsol pa /
translated: Kasyapa replied:

original: ma lags so //
analyzed: ma lags so //
translated: No, World-Honored One.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The World-Honored One said:

original: cig car ma mchis pa ma lags kyang mi rtag par 'dra'o //
analyzed: cig car ma mchis pa ma lags kyang mi rtag par 'dra'o //
translated: Even though they do not disappear at the same time, they are alike in being impermanent.

original: ci ste chos kyi sku mar gyi snod dang 'dra na /
analyzed: ci ste chos kyi sku mar gyi snod dang 'dra na /
translated: If the Dharma body is like the lamp-vessel,

original: mar me'i snod mi rtag pas chos kyi sku'ang de dang 'dra bar mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mar me'i snod mi rtag pas chos kyi sku'ang de dang 'dra bar mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: then because the lamp-vessel is impermanent, the Dharma body would be the same and also impermanent.

original: rigs kyi bu khyod de skad ces ma smra zhig /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod de skad ces ma smra zhig /
translated: Son of noble family, do not speak in that way!

original: 'jig rten na snod ces bya bar grags pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bla na med pa'i chos kyi snod ces bya ba snod ni mi rtag pa yin yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten na snod ces bya bar grags pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bla na med pa'i chos kyi snod ces bya ba snod ni mi rtag pa yin yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In the world, what is known as a ‘vessel’ and what is known as a ‘vessel’ for the unsurpassed Dharma of the Blessed Buddhas, although vessels are impermanent, the Thus-Gone One is not.

original: chos thams cad la mya ngan las 'da' ba ni rtag pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mya ngan las 'da' ba ni rtag pa ste /
translated: Nirvana for all phenomena is permanent.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas rtag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas rtag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is the essence of the Thus-Gone One, it is called ‘permanent.’

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Moreover, son of noble family,

original: me mar zad ces bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba la bya'o //
analyzed: me mar zad ces bya ba ni dgra bcom pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba la bya'o //
translated: ‘the exhaustion of the lamp’ refers to the nirvana of an arhat.

original: 'dod pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad med par byas pas na me mar zad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad med par byas pas na me mar zad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Because all afflictions of desire are eliminated, it is like the exhaustion of a lamp.

original: lan @105a *// gcig phyir mi ldog pa ni 'dod pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: lan @105a *// gcig phyir mi ldog pa ni 'dod pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Those who return once are still desirous.

original: 'dod pa dang bcas pas me mar zad pa lta bu zhes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang bcas pas me mar zad pa lta bu zhes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: Because they are desirous, it is not suitable to say they are like the exhaustion of a lamp.

original: de bas na ngas sngon mtshan ma dgag pa'i phyir me mar zad pa lta bu'o zhes bshad kyi /
analyzed: de bas na ngas sngon mtshan ma dgag pa'i phyir me mar zad pa lta bu'o zhes bshad kyi /
translated: Therefore, I have previously said that the extinction of a lamp is like the cessation of signs.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ni me mar zad pa lta bu ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ni me mar zad pa lta bu ma yin no //
translated: But the great parinirvāṇa is not like the extinction of a lamp.

original: lan gcig phyir mi ldog ces bya ba ni yang dang yang ldog pa ma yin /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir mi ldog ces bya ba ni yang dang yang ldog pa ma yin /
translated: As for “non-returner,” it means not returning again and again.

original: srid pa nyi shu lnga por phyir mi ldog cing /
analyzed: srid pa nyi shu lnga por phyir mi ldog cing /
translated: It means not returning to the twenty-five existences.

original: lus mnam po dang / lus srin can dang / lus gdug pa can mi len pas na phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya'o; ;lus yang len pa ni phyir ldog pa zhes bya yang lus mi len pa ni phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus mnam po dang / lus srin can dang / lus gdug pa can mi len pas na phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya'o; ;lus yang len pa ni phyir ldog pa zhes bya yang lus mi len pa ni phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It means not taking on a foul body, a body with parasites, or a poisonous body. Therefore it is called “non-returner.” Taking on a body again is called “returner,” but not taking on a body is called “non-returner.”

original: song ba dang ldog pa yod pas phyir ldog pa zhes bya /
analyzed: song ba dang ldog pa yod pas phyir ldog pa zhes bya /
translated: Because there is going and returning, it is called “returner.”

original: song ba dang ldog pa med pas phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: song ba dang ldog pa med pas phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because there is no going and returning, it is called “non-returner.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Kāśyapa addressed the Buddha, saying:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “World-Honored One!

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ltar dgongs te gsungs pa'i snying po mchis so zhes bgyi ba'i don de lta ma lags so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ltar dgongs te gsungs pa'i snying po mchis so zhes bgyi ba'i don de lta ma lags so //
translated: This is not so.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la dgongs te gsungs pa'i brjod pa ni mnga'i //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la dgongs te gsungs pa'i brjod pa ni mnga'i //
translated: The Buddha Bhagavat has the expression of the Tathāgata’s intention.

original: dgongs te gsungs pa'i snying po zhes bgyi ba ni ma mchis so //
analyzed: dgongs te gsungs pa'i snying po zhes bgyi ba ni ma mchis so //
translated: There is no so-called meaning of the Tathāgata’s intention.🔽For example, a magician makes a man of a wooden puppet.

original: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan zhig gis shing gi 'khrul 'khor gyi mi zhig bgyis @105b na; shing gi mi de ni kun gyis kyang mthong bar rung gi /
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan zhig gis shing gi 'khrul 'khor gyi mi zhig bgyis @105b na; shing gi mi de ni kun gyis kyang mthong bar rung gi /
translated: That wooden man can be seen by everyone,

original: brkyang ba dang / bskum pa dang / dgye pa dang / rgu ba ni nang nas bsgyur bar mi 'tshal to //
analyzed: brkyang ba dang / bskum pa dang / dgye pa dang / rgu ba ni nang nas bsgyur bar mi 'tshal to //
translated: but his stretching out and contracting, his bending and stretching, are not to be done from within.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni de lta bu ma lags te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni de lta bu ma lags te /
translated: The Buddha Dharma is not like that.

original: sems can thams cad kyis mthong zhing shes par bgyi ba lags na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis mthong zhing shes par bgyi ba lags na /
translated: If it is to be seen and known by all sentient beings,

original: ci'i slad du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs te gsungs pa'i snying po mchis zhes gsungs /
analyzed: ci'i slad du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs te gsungs pa'i snying po mchis zhes gsungs /
translated: Why did the Buddha say that the Tathāgata’s teachings have an underlying intent and a definitive meaning?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od srung la bka' stsal pa /🔽shin tu legs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od srung la bka' stsal pa / shin tu legs so //
translated: The Buddha said to Kāśyapa:🔽“Excellent!

original: shin tu legs so //
analyzed: shin tu legs so //
translated: Excellent!

original: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis smras pa bzhin te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis smras pa bzhin te /
translated: Good man, it is just as you have said.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la yang dag par na dgongs te gsungs pa'i snying po med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la yang dag par na dgongs te gsungs pa'i snying po med do //
translated: The Tathāgata’s teachings do not have an underlying intent or a definitive meaning.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
